title: kamen_rider_kabuto
body:
[i]"Walking the path of heaven, ruling over all."[/i]

Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider Kabuto (series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]], sixteenth show of the Kamen Rider series and seventh of the Heisei generation.

[[Tendou Souji]] is an enigmatic young man who has trained for 7 years in anticipation of the Kabuto Zecter, with which he combats the Worms, monsters feeding on and imitating humans, which came from a meteorite which destroyed Tokyo's Shibuya ward 7 years ago.

Kabuto is patterned after the Japanese rhinoceros beetle ("kabutomushi", [i]trypoxylus dichotomus[/i]). He has four forms - the bulky Masked (initial) and the sleek Rider (default) Forms, and the powered-up Hyper Kabuto and its winged Clock-Up Hyper Kabuto Forms. His special ability is Clock-Up, which gives him superspeed.
other_names: 仮面ライダーカブト(ライダー名)

title: dragon_ball_af
body:
Dragon Ball AF is a non-existent [[Dragon Ball]] series that was believed to be the continuation of [[Dragon Ball GT]] for the longest time, born out of fanart depicting a purported [[Super Saiyan]] 5 [[son goku|Goku]] from the fictional series ("in actuality":[https://thedaoofdragonball.com/blog/fans/dragon-ball-af-origin-revealed/] being a character named [[Tablos (dragon ball af)|]] in the Spirit-Killer form (post #6488113), drawn by the original fan creator of DBAF, [[TablosAF|David Montiel Franco]]). Rumors and misinformation of its existence spread, inspiring several fan made projects on the topic, most famously those by [[toyotarou|Toyble]] and [[youngjijii|Young Jijii]]. The original version by Franco has since received a continuation in the form of 'Dragon Ball AF Origins'.

h4. External link

* Dragon Ball Wikia: "Dragon Ball AF":https://dragonball.fandom.com/wiki/Dragon_Ball_AF

title: the_hillbilly_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character from [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]].

The Hillbilly, also known as Max Thompson Jr., is a highly mobile Killer, able to run with tremendous speed while revving his [[chainsaw]].

He is usually depicted as a [[balding]], [[disfigured]] man, wearing [[jeans]], a [[dirty]] and [[torn_shirt|torn]] [[grey_shirt|grey]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless shirt]], wielding a chainsaw and a [[hammer]] as his weapons.

title: gangut_(kancolle)
body:
The Imperial Russia/Soviet Union battleship Gangut (Cyrillic: Гангут) in [[Kantai Collection]] and the first native Russian shipgirl in the game. (While [[Verniy (kancolle)|]] is the first shipgirl from the Soviet Fleet, her origin isn't Russian as she was seized as a war trophy by the Soviet Union from Japan after WWII). She is named for the "Battle of Gangut":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gangut in 1714.

Her real life counterpart was launched in 1911 - one year before [[Kongou (kancolle)|]] launched. This made Gangut the oldest ship in the game upon her inclusion, later to be eclipsed by [[conte di cavour (kancolle)|Cavour]]. She was completed in 1915 and served with the Baltic Fleet during [[World War I]], though she saw only limited action. Her crew mutinied with the rest of the Baltic Fleet in the February Revolution of 1917.

Her appearance is somewhat similar to Hibiki (they share the same artist). Gangut has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes|red]]/[[orange eyes]]. In her basic form she wears a [[white jacket]] with [[belt]] over a [[red shirt]], [[black skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. She also wears [[black gloves]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] and a [[peaked cap]] with [b]a white crown and black visor[/b]. In her [[gangut dva (kancolle)|dva]] (Cyrillic: два, meaning "two") form, she wears her [[jacket on shoulders|jacket on her shoulders]], revealing her [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] red shirt and an [b] all black peaked cap[/b].

A noticeable trait shared with all her forms is a [[scar on cheek|scar under her left eye]] after being struck by a [[he 111|Heinkel He 111]] from Kampfgeschwader 4 (KG 4).

She is voiced by Seto Asami [瀬戸 麻沙美].

h4. See also

* [[Oktyabrskaya Revolyutsiya (Kancolle)|]]
other_names: ガングート(艦隊これくしょん)

title: the_wraith_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character featured in [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]] and [[hooked_on_you|Hooked on You]].

The Wraith, also known as Philip Ojomo, is a stealth Killer, able to become [[transparent]] and move with tremendous speed via the ringing of his weapon, the Wailing Bell, which is made out of his former bosses' [[skull]] and [[spine]]

He is usually depicted as a [[tall]], [[grey_skin|grey skinned]] man with [[antlers|antler]] like growths coming out of his head, three stripes of grey [[facepaint]] on his face, wearing a dark [[cloak]], with [[bandages]] on his torso.

title: i_don't_have_a_single_regret_in_my_life
body:
[b]我が生涯に一片の悔い無し![/b] ([i]Waga shougai ni ippen no kui nashi![/i]) Alternatively translated as [i]"Of this life, I have no regrets!"[/i]

[[raoh (hokuto no ken)|Raoh's]] famous [spoiler]last[/spoiler] words from [[Hokuto no Ken]] [spoiler]that he said before he uses the last of his energy to jettison his soul towards the sky to "return to Heaven" and bring true light back to the post-apocalyptic world, after he is defeated by [[Kenshiro]][/spoiler]. His iconic pose [spoiler]involving his lifeless body standing upright with his [[raised fist|right fist rising toward the sky]][/spoiler] has become a subject of parody and tributes.

The quote is later parodied with [[Umamusume]]'s [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] due to being one of her race-winning quotes.
other_names: 我が生涯に一片の悔い無し

title: the_trapper_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character featured in [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]] and [[hooked_on_you|Hooked on You]].

The Trapper, also known as Evan Macmillan, is an area-control Killer, able to place deadly [[bear_trap|bear traps]] for Survivors to step into.

He is usually depicted as a [[bald]], [[mask|masked]], [[muscular_male|muscular male]] with [[scar|scars]] on his chest, [[hook|hooks]] and [[spikes]] protruding from his shoulder area, wearing [[overalls]] and wielding a [[cleaver]] as his main weapon.

title: imperium_of_man
body:
The principal faction of [[Warhammer 40K]], the Imperium of Man was founded by [[emperor of mankind|The God-Emperor of Mankind]] and serves as the government for humanity. It has fallen far from the ideals of scientific enlightenment it was founded upon, instead consumed by intolerance, ignorance, and religious fanaticism following the events of the Horus Heresy and other crises. Its icons are a double-headed eagle known as the Aquila and the skull.

Its armed forces consist of the famous [[Adeptus Astartes]], the Space Marines, and countless, ordinary [[astra militarum|Imperial Guardsmen]], as well as an extensive navy. Internal security is handled by the Inquisition and its associated forces, such as the Officio Assassinorum and the [[Adepta Sororitas]], the Sisters of Battle, as well as the [[Adeptus Custodes]]. In charge of its industry is the [[adeptus mechanicus|Mechanicum]] based on Mars, infamous for their religious reverence of what technology the Imperium has been able to preserve.

Its most famous motto is "The Emperor Protects."

title: okaerinko
body:
おかえりんこ
This difficult-to-translate [[pun]] comes from stories of practical jokes long told on [[2channel]].

The archetype, as retold in post #116261:
======
Upon her return home, I said to my little sister - an 8th-grader - "[i]Okaeri-nko[/i]."
("[i]Okaeri[/i]" means "welcome back".)

She started to respond "[i]Tadaima-nko[/i]", before suddenly turning bright red and hitting me, saying "Geez! You pervert!" I got a huge kick out of her innocent reaction.
("[i]Tadaima[/i]" means "I'm home", and "[i]manko[/i]" means "[[pussy|vagina]]".)

Later, when my older sister came home from work, I said "Okaeri-nko" to her, too. Without the slightest change in expression, she responded "Tadaima-nko. What's for dinner tonight?" Impressed, I couldn't think of a thing to say.
======

This story was already in existence as of [[2003]]. As it has been spread around, various small variations have shown up.
It's particularly popular among boys with older sisters, and there are people who have actually tried it.
"[i]Okaeri-nko[/i]" is probably a variation on a the slang word "[i]tomodachi-nko[/i]", which is found in "Kobayashi Yoshinori":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshinori_Kobayashi 's manga "[i][[Obocchama-kun]][/i]."
("[i]Tomodachi[/i]" means "friend" and "[i]chinko[/i]" means "penis.")

body:

In Japan, the accessory is known as the [[Famicom]] Robot (shortened to simply "Robot" for his [i]Mario Kart[/i] and [i]Super Smash. Bros.[/i] appearances).

[[2channel]] denizens often use his [[ascii art]] for this nonsensical [[meme]] phrase: 奇蹟のカーニバル 開 幕 だ (Miracle carnival is starting [i]N O W[/i])

title: mmr_magazine_mystery_chousa_han
body:
MMR マガジンミステリー調査班 ("MMR Magazine Mystery [i]Chousa Han[/i]", "MMR Magazine Mystery Reportage") is a manga series written by Ishigaki Yuuki and serialized in "Weekly Shounen Magazine.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weekly_Sh%C5%8Dnen_Magazine 

Story plot: Editors of Weekly Shounen Magazine organized MMR, an investigation group of supernatural phenomena.

This manga is humorously well known by the following lines.

Kibayashi, the leader of MMR : "人類は滅亡する!" ("Mankind will perish!")
Other members: "な…なんだってー!?" ("[i]Na, Nandatteee!?[/i]", "W-what did you say!?")

h4.Characters

* [[Nawaya]]
* [[Tanaka (MMR)]]
* [[Ikeda (MMR)]]

title: msa-0120
body:
A [[mobile suit]] that is referenced as part of the backstory of [[Gundam F90]]. It has never actually appeared in the video franchises.

An advanced mobile suit designed by Anaheim Electronics for the E.F.F. While it vastly outperformed the F90 Gundam in most areas, cost was not one of them and was soundly rejected in favor of F90 gundam and its variants.

The official name for E.F.F.'s development/competition project is ATMS (Advance[sic] Tactical Mobile Suit). Based on this fact, a certain [[2channel]] user "invented" ATMOS/ATOMOSU as an alias for the MS. This name is treated as false information, as it is not seen as fanon.

title: jean_pierre_polnareff
body:
One of the central protagonists in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3: [[Stardust Crusaders]]. Also appears in Part 5:: [[Vento Aureo]] as a supporting character. His [[stand_(jojo)|stand]] is the [[Silver chariot]].

He became the origin of two Japanese well-known [[meme]]s. If you find these memes in the image, use [[Jean Pierre Polnareff]] tag and [[meme]] tag.

1) "あ…ありのまま 今 起こった事を話すぜ!" ("[i]A...arinomama Ima Okotta Koto wo Hanasuze![/i]", "L-let me tell you straight fact about what happened now!").
When a very unimaginably mysterious thing happened, this meme and his [[ASCII ART]] are used.

[quote]"Before we go after him, I have something to say!
I have barely experienced [[dio_brando|Dio]]'s stand. N-no, I have experienced it, but I don't understand what it is....
L-let me tell you straight fact about what happened now!
'[b]I was trying to climb the stairs to get him but somehow I ended up lower than where I started.[/b]'
[i]Y-you guys think I don't know what I'm talking about. I don't know what's going on at all...[/i] This is driving me crazy...
It's not something like hypnosis or super fast speed. What I experienced was just the tip of the iceberg...."
[/quote]

2) "現実は非情である" ("[i]Genjitsu wa Hijou de Aru[/i]", "Reality is Cruel")
[quote]This is a real problem. I'm injured. How can I get away?

There are three options.
One, the handsome Polnareff figures out a way to counter the attack.
Two, my friends will save me.
Or three, reality is cruel and I die here.
[/quote]

h4.See also

* Wikipedia article: "Jean Pierre Polnareff":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Pierre_Polnareff

title: akita_nero
body:
亞北ネロ (Akita Nero) is a [[Vocaloid]] derivative designed by [[Smith Hioka]] as [[Akita Neru]]'s younger brother.
He is a 13 years old boy with [[blonde hair]] and an [[ahoge]].

When [[Hatsune Miku]]'s pictures became unsearchable on main search engines such as Google and Yahoo! Japan in 2007, an apocryphal rumor spread among [[2channel]]  users:
"The system engineers at Yahoo! Japan had not enough time to work out the bugs in their image recognition algorithms. They decided to check all unsearchable images [b]one by one manually[/b], to change all Miku's pictures to ’searchable’."
Nero was created as one of these poor, overworked part-time engineers in Yahoo!.

h4.See also

* Nero's first image, posted to 2ch on November 22, 2007: http://akita-neru.at.webry.info/200712/article_5.html
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/434654

title: uso_desu
body:
This tag referes to the ASCII-art "uso desu" (ウソです) which means "it's a lie,"and is used in [[2channel]], Japanese biggest BBS.
The AA is as following
     *      *
  ＊  ウソです  ＋
     n ∧＿∧ n
 ＋ (ﾖ（* ´∀｀）E)
      Y     Y    ＊ 
and used to completely deny all text written in the 1st comment of the boring thread (mainly in 2nd comment.) Additionally, it is a kind of manner in 2ch to write "A lie, I see" (なんだうそか) immediately if you see this AA.

h4. Usage Example (2ch style in English)

Thread title : I found pretty innovative fact !!!!

1 Name：VIP warrior [sage] date：2008/12/07(Sun) 14:15:52.88
Chocolate dissolves a chewing gum in your mouth!!!LOLOL

2 Name：VIP warrior [sage] date：2008/12/07(Sun) 14:17:39.12
     *      *
  ＊  ウソです  ＋
     n ∧＿∧ n
 ＋ (ﾖ（* ´∀｀）E)
      Y     Y    ＊ 

3 Name：VIP warrior [sage] date：2008/12/07(Sun) 14:18:16.39
A lie, I see.

Unrelated to [[uso da]].

h4.See also

* [[2channel]] [[Ascii Art]] Illustrations (Japanese): "Uso Desu":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Usodesu.html

* [[meme]]

title: hinomoto_oniko
body:
A [[personification]] of the Chinese degarotary insult 日本鬼子/rìběn guǐzi ("nihon onigo" in Japanese), which means "Japanese Devils." The word itself originated from the 2001 Japanese doctumentary of the same name about various surviving veteran of the Sino-Japanese wars and [[World War II]] recounting their war crimes. This word is often used in a debate revolves around the annual homage to the [[Yasukuni shrine]] (the resting place of several Japanese war criminals).

 Her name is derived from an alternative reading of the characters, where 日本 = "Hinomoto" and 鬼子 = "Oniko." There is an [[UTAU]] based on her character. She was created from [[2channel]] members to counter the Chinese cyberattack.

h4.See also

* Official design: post #778670 by [[No. 015]]
* Wiki(JP): http://www16.atwiki.jp/hinomotooniko/
** UTAU: http://www43.atwiki.jp/utauoniko/
*** UTAU wiki: http://utau.wikia.com/wiki/Oniko_Hinomoto
* [[kohinomoto]]
* [[hannya]] & [[mask]]
* [[hiwaidori]]
* [[yaikagashi]]

title: densha_otoko
body:
[i][b]Densha Otoko[/b][/i] (translated as [i][b]Train Man[/b][/i]) is a Japanese movie, television series, manga, novel, and other media, all based on the purportedly true love story of an [[otaku]].

The story was chronicled on the Japanese internet mega-BBS [[2channel]]. This led to the compilation of the relevant threads in a book, followed by several manga versions, a movie, a theatrical play later released as a DVD, and finally a TV series.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Densha_Otoko]

title: churuya
body:
A [[chibi]]-fied version of [[Tsuruya]] from [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]], created by [[Eretto]] in post #47838.

The two have fairly dissimilar personalities. Whereas Tsuruya is easily excitable and laughs a lot, Churuya seems more simple-minded, and has a deep appreciation for [[smoked cheese]]. Her signature catchphrase is [[nyoro~n]].

Churuya first appeared on Eretto's website in a now famous [[4koma]] (post #47838). Churuya inherited Eretto's love of smoked cheese. Notably, in the last panel Churuya utters her catchphrase [[nyoro~n]] when she becomes disappointed by the lack of smoked cheese. Likely one major reason for Churuya's popularity is the sense of schadenfreude at Churuya's perpetual misfortune.

From the very start, fan reaction to Eretto's Churuya comics was wildly positive. After being linked on [[2channel]], Eretto's site would frequently go down because of all the traffic. Eretto continued to write new Churuya-san 4koma, and has even anthologized them in doujinshi.

[[Churuya]] became a meme frequently used by other artists. Usually the one common factor is the last panel, where a character drawn in the style of Churuya (complete with [[:3]]) says [i]nyoro~n[/i] or some variation thereof.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Nyoron":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/nyoron

title: jigoku_no_misawa_(style)
body:
[[Jigoku no Misawa]]'s style of drawing.

地獄のミサワ ([i]Jigoku no Misawa[/i]) is a mangaka notorious for his really horrible comics, beloved by [[2channel|2channelers]]. His real name is "三澤 大気 (Misawa Taiki.)"

He draws a webcomic on his home page, 女に惚れさす名言集 ([i]Onna ni Hore-sasu Meigen-shuu[/i]), which consists entirely of pictures of guys who act cool, but are not. He also draws カッコカワイイ宣言 ([i]Kakko-kawaii Sengen[/i]) for Jump Square.

body:
Some sort of Japanese meme or reference. Includes characters uttering こうですか? わかりません (_Like that? I don't understand_), whilst making some pose, usually bending.

Unconfirmed (archived) source: http://yet.s61.xrea.com/mt/archives/000108.html

Translation:

* Poster asks to be taught how to ASCII-art a specific [[2channel]] character

after which someone responds with

and OP responds with 

* "Like that? I don't understand! Please explain"

title: airplane_arms
body:
Pretending to be an [[airplane]] by [[spread arms|spreading the arms]] straight out to the sides, usually while running or otherwise in motion.

In Japanese, the [[sound effects|sound effect]] of an [[airplane]] flying is ブーン ("bu-n"). Consequently, airplane arms are known as "bu-n" in Japanese. "Bu-n" is also a nickname and catchphrase of "内藤ホライゾン" (Naitou Horizon), an [[ASCII art]] character who is a mascot for [[2channel]]'s VIP board.

title: kuma_(2ch)
body:
クマー(Kumaa) is an [[ASCII Art]] character of [[2channel|2channel]], the origin of [[Pedobear]].

He is famous for appearing with this [[meme]]: "そんな釣りで俺様がクマーー！！"
"I'll not get hooked on your blatant troll comment! I'll ignore yo— [i](He bites at the hook)[/i] Oh, no!"

He was exported to [[4chan]] and became Pedobear.
[[Analoguma]] was made from Kuma, too.

Unlike Pedobear, Kuma and Analoguma are not paedophiles at all.

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia (JP): クマー":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%AF%E3%83%9E%E3%83%BC]

title: moot
body:
Also known as Christopher Poole. Founder and former owner of [[4chan]], until he sold that site to [[2channel]] owner [[Nishimura Hiroyuki (2ch)|]]. It is rumored that he nowadays works at Google.

He is often, for reasons known only to [[4chan]] itself, depicted as a small bipedal white cat with a pink shirt labeled 'Moot' and a pink bow in his hair.

body:

Main protagonist of [[Super Robot Wars K]]. He has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange_hair|orange]] [[short hair]]. He's an alien from the planet called アトリーム(Atream, Atriem or Atreem), and was a pilot of its Defence Force, until the planet got destroyed by mysterious enemies.

The game's threadbare plot and his occasionally jerkass tendencies have made the players hate him and they ironically nicknamed him "Mist-san."

title: geesen_de_deatta_fushigi_na_ko_no_hanashi
body:
ゲーセンで出会った不思議な子の話 ("The Story of A Mysterious Girl Who I Met in A Game Center")

A series of two threads on "'News for VIP+'":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9B%91%E8%AB%87%E7%B3%BB2_%282%E3%81%A1%E3%82%83%E3%82%93%E3%81%AD%E3%82%8B%E3%82%AB%E3%83%86%E3%82%B4%E3%83%AA%29#.E3.83.8B.E3.83.A5.E3.83.BC.E9.80.9FVIP.2B board in [[2channel]]. The threads were created by an anonymous [[2channel]] user in January, 2012. In November 2012 the author, "Tomizawa Minami,":http://twitter.com/tomizawa_2ch confessed that the story was fiction. Subsequently it was published as "a book by Enterbrain":http://www.enterbrain.co.jp/product/mook/mook_bungei/213_other/13230301.html in September 2013.

title: kishibe_rohan
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Heaven's Door]]. Wears a distinctive jagged headband and earrings that look like fountain pen nibs.

A famous Mangaka, Rohan may be a fantastical [[artist self-insert]] of [[Araki Hirohiko]]. He shares Araki's love of traveling and has starred in multiple one-shot side stories titled [[Kishibe Rohan Wa Ugokanai]].

He became the origin of Japanese meme, "だが断る" ("[i][[Daga Kotowaru]][/i]", "[b]I REFUSE.[/b] What I like to do the most is say NO to people who consider themselves extremely good."). It is used to refuse "'an offer he can't refuse.'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather#Cultural_influence_and_legacy 

h4. External links

* [[2channel]] Ascii-art Illustrations (Japanese): "[i]Daga Kotowaru[/i]":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Rohan.html

title: yaruopoona
body:
やるオプーナ (Yaruopoona / Yaruopuuna) is an [[Ascii art]] character that was born from the [[2channel]] board "Games: Hardware & Industry," and it is strongly associated with the 2007 Wii game [[Opoona]].
The titular character of the game has a unique design. He looks like a stuffed doll that has an orange sphere, called "Energy Bon Bon", floating over his head, which attracted the interest of many 2ch users.
Officials from the game's publisher KOEI announced at the game press release conference that they were aiming for the sale of half a million to a million copies of the game. However, the initial sales figures were extremely low, and 2ch users believed that the producer / character designer Majima Shintarou and the developer ArtePiazza were responsible for this.

Yaruopoona is a [[fusion]] character that combines Opoona and another 2ch Ascii art character named [[Yaruo]]. The sphere over Yaruopoona's head differs from the original in that it is supported by a brace sticking out from the top of his head. He always has a grimace on his face but quite frequently tries to give you a purchase deed, while saying "Good Job! As a reward, I will give you the right to buy Opoona!" in an extremely condescending tone of voice. However, next to him used to stand a cart of new games on special bargain sale which was piled up to the top with Opoona games.

The reason for the game's slow sales was the fact that its launch date happened to coincide with the launch date of [[Super Mario Galaxy]]. However, afterward it became clear that the game was actually of decent quality, and the game title and the developers regained their good reputation. Even now, "Yaruopoona" and the phrase "I will give you the right to buy...!" are still extremely well-known.

Opoona has been incorporated as one of [[Zack (DOA)|]]'s costumes in "[[Dead or Alive]]: Dimensions." In this costume, Zack's win quote was "I will give you the right to fight me!"

h4.See also

* 2ch all Ascii-Art illustrations: http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Opu-na.html

title: zz
swadloon
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #541 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Bug/Grass Pokémon.
Swadloon is a round, yellow Pokémon inside of a cloak of leaves. It drapes the leaves over itself and draws them closed around its body, so only a large, crescent slit remains for its face to appear. This leafy cloak keeps the Pokémon warm. Under its cloak are darker green, limp leaves which frame the sides of Swadloon's face and trail down on the sides of its body.

It evolves from [[Sewaddle]] and evolves into [[Leavanny]]. 
Japanese Name: [b]Kurumayu[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Sewaddle]]
Next Pokémon: [[Leavanny]]

title: leavanny
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #542 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Bug/Grass Pokémon.
Leavanny is a thin, yellow, bipedal insectoid Pokémon. It has a broad, split leaf around its large, round head and it has long antennae that end in semicircles. Its eyes are red with no apparent sclera. Its tiny thorax is dark green, and its long abdomen is yellow and covered in a green leaf. Its hands are long and leaf-like with a "bite" taken out of each.

It evolves from [[Swadloon]].
Japanese Name: [b]Hahakomori[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Swadloon]]
Next Pokémon: [[Venipede]]

title: testicular_torsion
body:
[b]Testicular torsion[/b] is a pathological condition exclusive to men that happens when the spermatic cord (from which the testicle is suspended) twists, cutting off the blood supply to the testicle. Is more frequent during puberty and is usually caused by traumatic injuries to the scrotum or after excesive vigorous physical activity. 

The main symptom is severe and constant testicular pain. It can be treated surgically if detected on time. Failure to do so may lead to permanent infertility.

title: gaff_(blade_runner)
body:
One of the main characters from the 80s [[Science Fiction]] film, [[Blade Runner]]. He is played by actor [[Edward James Olmos]].

[b]Gaff[/b] is a veteran, silent and enigmatic Blade Runner who always dresses formaly and wears a hat. He walks with a cane and a noticeable limp. 

Gaff often communicates in a strange street lingo called "Cityspeak" that is a mixture of Japanese, Spanish, German, English and many other languages.

title: leon_(blade_runner)
body:
A character from the 80s [[cyberpunk]] science fiction movie [[Blade Runner]]. He was played by the late American actor "Brion James":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brion_James.

[b]Leon Kowalski[/b] is a member of [[Roy Batty]]'s band of fugitive [[replicant]]s in the film. Leon has an A Physical Level (superhuman strength and endurance) & a C Mental Level (subnormal intelligence). 

He is often brutal and sadistic in his methods but not very smart, even for human standards. Because of this Leon tends to resort to raw savagery and violence when trapped in a difficult and stressing situation he can't control. 

His model number is NEXUS-6 N6MAC41717.
other_names: リオン・コワルスキー

title: zhora
body:
A character from the 80s [[cyberpunk]] science fiction movie [[Blade Runner]]. She is played by American actress "Joanna Cassidy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joanna_Cassidy .

[b]Zhora[/b], a [[replicant]], has an A Physical Level (superhuman strength and endurance) & a B Mental Level (normal intelligence). She has been trained in political homicide (i.e. assassination). 

Zhora is a member of [[Roy Batty]]'s band of fugitives. She managed to get a job as an exotic dancer at Taffey's Bar in the film. 

Her model number is NEXUS-6 N6FAB61216.

title: pris
body:
A character from the 80s [[cyberpunk]] science fiction film [[Blade Runner]] played by actress [[Daryl Hannah]].

[b]Pris[/b] is a member of [[Roy Batty]]'s band of fugitive replicants in the film. 

Pris is a "pleasure model" [[replicant]] created for entertainment and thus even more of a slave-object than the others. She has an A Physical level (superhuman strength and endurance), but her B Mental Level (standard intelligence) puts her at a lower intellectual level than Roy. 

Pris was incepted (developed) on [[valentine|Valentine's day]].  

Her model number is NEXUS-6 N6FAB21416.
other_names: プリス・ストラットン

title: rachel_(blade_runner)
body:
[b]Rachel[/b], also known as [b]Rachael[/b] or [b]Rachael Tyrell[/b], is a character from the science fiction film [[Blade Runner]], played by actress [[Sean Young]].

She is [spoiler]a Nexus 7 [[replicant]] with B physical and mental levels (regular human type) that was also given the ability to reproduce and a normal person's lifespan. Her serial number is NEXUS-7 N7FAA52318. Rachael also appears in the sequel [[Blade Runner 2049]].[/spoiler]

title: roy_batty
body:
A character from the 80s [[cyberpunk]] science fiction movie [[Blade Runner]]. He is the main antagonist in the film and was played by actor [[Rutger Hauer]].

[b]Roy Batty[/b] is the leader of the renegade Nexus-6 [[replicant]]s. He is very intelligent, strong, resilient, fast, and skilled at combat, and yet still learning how to deal with developing emotions. 

With an A Physical Level (superhuman strength & endurance) and an A Mental Level (genius level intellect), he is probably the most dangerous of all the fugitive replicants. 

He is an specialized combat model, used off-world for [[military]] service, and is said to have participated in every off-world battle and conflict from the fighting at the Tannhauser Gate to the Massacre on the Venezeualan Moons.

Roy leads a few fellow replicants in the hope of self-preservation during the film. 

His model number is NEXUS-6 N6MAA10816.

title: hoxy?
body:
A Korean gacha [[meme]] based on the [[romaja text|transliteration]] of the word '혹시', which translates best as "Perhaps (you)". So when someone says Hoxy, they are basically saying "Perhaps you don't have this?" in a smug way. Originated with [[Closers]], popularized with [[Girls' Frontline]]'s Korean fanbase.

In [[Girls' Frontline]]'s case, the word is typically used for hard-to-acquire dolls, either due to atrocious drop rates for farmable dolls or atrocious production rates otherwise. The doll historically associated with this phrase is [[Five-seveN (girls' frontline)|]], whose drop rates during KR Cube were particularly atrocious, resulting in the meme sprouting up. Players who managed to acquire her made it a bragging point, and "teased":[/posts/6793612] those who lacked her. [[P90 (girls' frontline)|]]'s production rate was similarly infamous, leading to similar. The word has since then also been used for other time-limited dolls, particularly those that end up being very important (or just generally rare) farming targets that are otherwise unacquirable or just hard-to-get like [[Python (girls' frontline)|]] or [[M870 (girls' frontline)|]]. Due to the prevalence of the Korean fanbase, the word would be wholesale exported to the Global fanbase, and "communally translated":[https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1029713736083300352] to the Japanese fanbase.

h4. External links
* namuwiki: "HOXY":[https://namu.wiki/w/HOXY]

title: playerunknown's_battlegrounds
body:
A 2017 multiplayer battle royale shooter game developed and published by Krafton, and one of the earlier contributors to the battle royale craze alongside [[Fortnite]]. The game is  free-to-play on all consoles as of January 2022, and retains a level of popularity among streamers and eSports players.

A mobile port published by Tencent was released in 2018. This version is known for having many exclusive collaborations with outside copyrights - including anime series, real-world fashion brands, and western entertainment franchises. Some of the copyrights that have collaborated with the mobile version include [[Jujutsu Kaisen]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], [[A Bathing Ape]], [[The Boys]], [[Arcane: League of Legends]], [[Warframe]], [[Squid Game]], and [[Assassin's Creed]].

title: nigeru_wa_haji_daga_yaku_ni_tatsu
body:
[i]Nigeru wa Haji daga Yaku ni Tatsu[/i] ([i]Running Away is Shameful but Useful[/i]) is a Japanese romance jōsei manga series written and illustrated by [[Umino Tsunami]]. The story centers around [[Moriyama Mikuri]] and [[Tsuzaki Hiramasa]], a housekeeper and a salaryman who decide to get married after learning that her parents are moving to the countryside and he doesn't want to lose his keeper.

It's published by Kodansha, with serialization on Kiss magazine since November 9, 2012 and ten volumes compiling the chapters released so far. It also has been adapted to a Japanese TV drama broadcasted by TBS from October 11, 2016, starring [[Aragaki Yui]] and [[Hoshino Gen]] as the lead characters. The TV drama was renewed for a one-off sequel on January 2, 2021 with Aragaki and Hoshino reprising their roles.

h4. See Also

* [[Koi Dance]]

h4. External Link

* "Wikipedia Entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeru_wa_Haji_da_ga_Yaku_ni_Tatsu

title: kemomimi_oukoku_kokuei_housou
body:
Otherwise referred to as [b]Kemomimi Oukoku[/b], it is the name of the managing brand behind 3DCG artist [[Nekomasu_(nekomasu1)|]]'s channels since early 2018. Run by the artist, he is also referred to as Virtual Nojaloli Kitsunemusume YouTuber Ojisan and appeared as [[Mikoko (kemomimi oukoku kokuei housou)|]] on the channel.

Nekomasu would "announce":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6IPh2ggvdZ4] in July 2018 that the channel was shifting to be more akin to a virtual variety channel, and that the channel had been sold to [[LiveCartoon|LiveCartoon.LLC]]. The channel rebranded as a result, going from "Kemomimi VR Channel" to  "Virtual Program Channel" (バーチャル番組チャンネル; briefly バーチャル番組連盟 at first) as Nekomasu moved away from YouTube, opting for Twitter and Niconico, branding himself "Virtual Nojaloli Kitsunemusume [i]Former[/i] YouTuber Ojisan" and eschewing the VTuber handle altogether, not considering himself one at all.

The original channel would go dormant after August 2019, and a new successor channel, simply titled Kemomimi Oukoku, would emerge later in October, its host gradually becoming a new model, Nekomasu-chan. The original channel would end up losing its branding entirely by May 2020, just becoming "_" as it continued to lay dormant. It wouldn't be until January 3rd, 2021 that the channel was once more returned to Nekomasu, being renamed to "Kemomimi Oukoku「Kitsune」", with all the LiveCartoon era videos becoming unlisted.

h4. Characters

* [[Mikoko (kemomimi oukoku kokuei housou)|]]
* [[Nekoma (kemomimi oukoku kokuei housou)|]] (Virtual Nekomimi Majokko YouTuber Ojisan)
* [[Nekomasu-chan]]
* Nezumi-san

h4. External links

title: sachiel_(evangelion)
body:
[[Alien]] [[monster]] character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

[b]Sachiel[/b] is the third [[Angel_(evangelion)|]] and the first Angel to attack Tokyo-3. It is a massive, vaguely humanoid creature with large bony structures on its shoulders and torso, gill-like structures on its legs, tridactyl hands, and a distinctive beaked face.

Notable because it's the very [b]first Angel featured in the original anime TV series[/b].

Designed by [[Asari Yoshitoo]]

title: at_field
body:
A term used in the series [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] to describe a protective [[energy]] field used by the [[angel_(evangelion)|Angels]]. It is short for "Absolute Terror Field". The most used form is the "Defensive AT Field", so when it is hit, there is a visible octagonal fluctuation.

The [[lance_of_longinus_(evangelion)|Lance of Longinus]] is the only known weapon capable of breaking it.

title: washing_machine
body:
An appliance used to wash [[clothes]]. The term applies primarily to [[machine]]s that use [[water]] as opposed to dry cleaning or ultrasonic cleaners. The user adds laundry [[detergent]], sold in liquid or powder form, to the wash water.

* [[laundromat]]

title: top-load_washing_machine
body:
A type of electric [[washing machine]] where the opening to load it is on the top.

Inside the machine the clothes go into a vertical drum where an agitator or impeller inside will move the clothes around while in operation.  They tend to be less common in places where space is a premium as the opening at the top makes it difficult to stack with other washing machines or [[clothes dryer]]s to save in floor space.  Some units do come in a stacked configuration with a dryer on top, but this is usually done through restricting the opening to the washing machine making it more difficult to put in and take out clothing.

As the opening is on the top, this type of washing machine does not need to have a locking mechanism on the door to prevent people from opening it while it operation like a front-load washing machine.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Washing machine (Top-loading)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washing_machine#Top-loading]

title: yagoo
body:
Tanigou Motoaki is the CEO of Cover corp. which owns [[Hololive]] and [[Holostars]]. The "YAGOO" nickname was born from [[Oozora Subaru]] accidentally misreading his surname during a stream (谷 "tani" can be read as "ya").

During the early days of promoting Hololive, he had described Cover Corp's initial vision of their Virtual Idols as more traditional and conventional in behavior (similar to groups like [[AKB48]], according to him).  As Hololive gained in popularity partly due to the talents' behavior not befitting of the traditional idol mold, he frequently became the target of jokes of "having his idol dreams ruined".

* "YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/user/tanigox

title: alisha_diphda
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. A righteous and chivalrous princess/knight of Hyland kingdom who meets [[sorey (tales)|Sorey]] at the beginning of the game. Although she tries to accompany him on his journey as the Shepherd, she is unable to stay with him long and must leave the party for his well-being.

h4.Costume Titles

* [[alisha diphda (beachside girl)|Beachside Girl]] (swimsuit)
* [[alisha diphda (demure librarian)|Demure Librarian]] (school)
* [[alisha diphda (hyland royalty)|Hyland Royalty]] (formal dress)

title: zaveid_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. A wind seraph who acts cocky and laid-back, but is highly capable as a fighter. He encounters Sorey's party several times, killing hellions when they want to save them and challenging their pacifist beliefs.

He is also seen in [[Tales of Berseria]], primarily as [[eizen (tales)|Eizen]]'s rival. His attitude toward hellions (AKA daemons) is actually reversed in this game, trying to find a way to save them rather than kill them.

h4.Costume Titles

* [[zaveid (punk guidance counselor) (tales)|Punk Guidance Counselor]] (school)
* [[zaveid (tropical beach bum) (tales)|Tropical Beach Bum]] (swimsuit)

title: dezel_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. A wind seraph who had been following [[rose (tales)|Rose]] around without her knowledge (since humans can't see seraphim). Dezel seeks vengeance against a hellion, so his behavior is gruff on first appearance. In fact, he is a caring fellow who is highly protective of Rose.

h4.Costume Titles

* [[dezel (dark lifeguard) (tales)|Dark Lifeguard]] (swimsuit)
* [[dezel (taciturn professor) (tales)|Taciturn Professor]] (school)

title: rose_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. A cheerful and optimistic young woman who travels as a merchant. Until she met [[sorey (tales)|Sorey]], she had no idea that [spoiler]she was being followed and protected by the wind seraph [[dezel (tales)|Dezel]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She is actually the boss of the assassin's guild Scattered Bones, which Sorey finds out when Rose joins the party.[/spoiler]

h4.Costume Titles

* [[rose (beach girl) (tales)|Beach Girl]] (swimsuit)
* [[rose (christmas) (tales)|Christmas]]

* [[rose (sparrowfeathers outfit) (tales)|Sparrowfeathers outfit]]

title: edna_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. [[eizen (tales)|Eizen]]'s younger sister. An earth-elemental Seraph who doesn't trust humans, but begrudgingly accompanies [[sorey (tales)|Sorey]]'s party. Edna is both crude and playful towards more naive characters like Mikleo and Alisha, but she does come through for the party.

title: ink_(medium)
body:
A medium that consists of [[ink]] which has been applied to a surface, typically paper. The ink can be applied using different tools, such as a [[nib pen (medium)|nib pen]], [[ballpoint pen (medium)|ballpoint pen]], [[millipen (medium)|technical pen]], [[marker_(medium)|marker]], or [[calligraphy brush (medium)|brush]], or through the [[print_(medium)|printmaking process]]. Ink is commonly black, but can be blue, as in the case of some ballpoint pens, or [[color ink (medium)|come in many colors]]. Depending on the method used, ink can appear as lines of constant or varying width, or in large swatches.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ink":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ink

title: mako_mori
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction mecha series. She appears in the first 2013 live action film and its 2018 sequel, [[Pacific Rim: Uprising]]. 

In the events of the first movie [b]Mako Mori[/b] is a young Japanese Jaeger [[mecha]] pilot with streaked blue and black hair and a [[bob cut]]. She is very brave and skilled at combat, yet very gentle, tender and humane.

In the sequel set 10 years later Mako has become a highly respected (and very efficient) [[Pan Pacific Defense Corps]] senior officer. [spoiler]She sadly (apparently) perished some time later when her transport helicopter was shot down by a [[obsidian_fury|rogue Jaeger mecha]] during a fierce battle in the city of Sidney (Australia) near a PPDC base.[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] she is played by Japanese actress [[Kikuchi Rinko]], while her younger self is played by [[Ashida Mana]].

title: nib_pen_(object)
body:
Any style of [[pen]] that uses a nib to write with liquid ink. [[quill|Quill pens]] are considered visually distinct and have their own tag.  

For images that were drawn on [[traditional media]] with a nib pen, see [[nib pen (medium)]].

h4. See also

* [[inkwell]]
* [[wax seal]]

title: nib_pen_(medium)
body:
A work of [[traditional media]] drawn with a nib pen, a [[pen]] that requires constant dipping in an ink reservoir to function.

An advanced tool, this difficult medium takes a lot of practice to get the hang of, but rewards with rich expression and superior control over one's lines. 

For images that depict a nib pen, use [[nib pen (object)]].

title: fudepen_(medium)
body:
A work of [[traditional media]] drawn with a fudepen. A fudepen (also known as a brush pen) is an ink [[pen]] with a brush-like tip that writes like a traditional [[calligraphy brush]].

The ink used is unlike traditional calligraphy ink. It is designed to adhere well to modern paper, while traditional ink only adheres well to rice paper.

h4. See also

* [[traditional media]]
* [[brush (medium)]]
* [[ink (medium)]]
* [[nib pen (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fudepen":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fudepen

title: calligraphy_pen_(medium)
body: Ambiguous, use [[fudepen (medium)]] or [[nib pen (medium)]] instead.

title: hagoromo
body:
A [b]hagoromo[/b] (羽衣, lit. "Feather Robe") is a long, thin [[shawl]] often associated with far-east celestial beings and deities.

Despite being thin, it is often depicted being able to remain upright in the air on its own. The cloth was modeled after ancient China's clothing called, [i]pi-bo[/i] (披帛).

Tales associated with the hagoromo include the Japanese legend of [i]tennin[/i] (spirtual beings who wear hagoromo) and some folkloric stories set in China, for example, [[Orihime (tanabata)|]] and [[Hikoboshi]].

Buddhist deities' hagoromo-like shawls are called "天衣" (Chinese: [i]tian yi[/i], Japanese: [i]tenne[/i], [i]ten'e[/i], or [i]ten'i[/i]). On Danbooru, tian yi should be tagged as hagoromo for convenience. 

h4. See also

* [[Flowing dress (dq)|]] (a hagoromo-like item in [[Dragon Quest]])

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tennin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennin
* "Wikipedia: Velificatio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velificatio (a similar concept in classical Western art)
* "Wikipedia (JP): Legend of Hagoromo":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%BD%E8%A1%A3%E4%BC%9D%E8%AA%AC

title: dirndl
body:
A dirndl is a type of traditional [[dress]] worn in Bavaria, Liechtenstein, Austria and South Tyrol, based on the historical costume of Alpine peasants. An iconic outfit for female [[beer]] [[waitress|servers]] during [[Oktoberfest]].

A dirndl consists of a [[bodice]] and [[skirt]] or a [[pinafore dress]], a low-cut [[blouse]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], and a [[waist apron]].

The position of the [[apron]] [[bow]] can indicate a woman's marital status:

* Bow on left: [b]Single[/b]
* Bow on right: [b]Married[/b]
* Bow in middle: [b]Virgin[/b]
* Bow in back: [b]Widow[/b] [i](or waitress)[/i]

h4. See also

* [[Oktoberfest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dirndl":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirndl

title: dorami
body:
One of the recurring characters of [i][[Doraemon]][/i]. A yellow "cat robot" from the 22nd century specifically programmed to be a "younger sister" figure of [[Doraemon (character)|]].

She is the production model of Doraemon (a prototype robot) and thus has various features that her brother lacked along with some improvements. She is also a lot lighter despite being only slighty smaller, weighing only 36 kg at a height of 100 cm.

Dorami was bought by [[Nobi Nobita]]'s great-great-grandson [[Nobi Sewashi]] as a household robot after Doraemon was sent to aid Nobita in the past. She is usually portrayed as a somewhat overprotective sister, occasionally traveling from the future to bring Doraemon back for his maintenance.

As with her brother, Dorami also has a "Fouth Dimension Bag" with various gadgets from the future, albeit often with girly aesthetics. As per Sewashi's request, her "ears" was modified into the shape of large red ribbon in the hope that Doraemon would not feel inferior to Dorami for his own missing ears.

title: kosode
body: The kosode (小袖, lit. 'small sleeves') was a type of short-sleeved Japanese garment, and the direct predecessor of the kimono. Though its component parts directly parallel those of the kimono, its proportions differed, typically having a wider body, a longer collar and narrower sleeves. The sleeves of the kosode were typically sewn to the body entirely, and often featured heavily rounded outer edges.

body: Original character by [[canadiananiguy]]. Has [[long_hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Usually wears a [[white jacket]], [[red sports bra]], and [[black]] [[bike shorts]].

title: b&t_mp9
body:
A 9x19mm [[submachine gun|machine pistol]] manufactured by Swiss company Brügger & Thomet since 2001. It is a further development of the earlier Steyr TMP, originally designed in 1989 and manufactured by Steyr Mannlicher of Austria, before selling it to B&T in 2001. It has a handgun-like configuration, and a tubular [[vertical foregrip]], with additional features new to the MP9 including an integrated Picatinny rail on top, a new trigger safety and a side-[[folding stock]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[TMP (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Brügger & Thomet MP9":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brügger_%26_Thomet_MP9
* "Wikipedia: Steyr TMP":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_TMP

title: ots-33
body:
The [b]OTs-33 Pernach / ОЦ-33 Пернач[/b] (multi-flanged [[mace]]) is a Russian selective fire, 9×18mm Makarov [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/b].  It was designed to replace the Stechkin APS in various special OMON units within the Russian [[police]], the [[Russia]]n Ministry of Internal Affairs (MVD) and other paramilitary units. The OTs-33 was developed in 1995 by Igor Stechkin at the "TsKIB SOO":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TsKIB_SOO] design bureau, and it went into limited production at the "KBP Instrument Design Bureau":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KBP_Instrument_Design_Bureau]. Also known as the АП СБЗ-2 (AP SBZ-2). The design was made to resolve the difficulty of controlling recoil in full-auto mode present in the [[Stechkin APS]] and simplifying it for combat deployment. The new OTs-33 has a more square shape, which is simpler to manufacture and has a novel operating principle that increases controllability and reduces recoil.

Easily identified by its boxy slide and ambidextrous (visible on both sides) firing selector switch located on the rear end of the slide as well as a detachable shoulder rig / stock (as seen here: post #3043608).

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "OTs-33 Pernach":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OTs-33_Pernach]

title: stunfisk
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #618 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Electric/Ground Pokémon.
Stunfisk is a flat, fish-like Pokémon with a broad, mud-brown body. At the base of its yellow tail is a yellow marking shaped like an [[!|exclamation mark]] when seen from behind. It has small, horizontal, oval-shaped eyes, white with a tiny black pupil and no irises. Almost exactly between these two eyes lies its mouth, which is comprised of two thick gray lips. It has two small, flimsy fins at the sides of its body; each with two lobes. It has been seen to leap into the air and flap its fins as if they're wings to remain airborne.

It does not evolve from or into any other Pokémon.
Japanese Name: [b]Maggyo[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Accelgor]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mienfoo]]

title: beretta_93r
body:
The Beretta 93R is an [[italy|Italian]] selective-fire 9×19mm [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/b], designed and manufactured by Beretta in the late 1970s. Its design is based on the [[Beretta 92]]. The [[weapon]] features a foldable  [[vertical foregrip]], an enlarged trigger guard, six-vent muzzle brake, and a detachable [[shoulder stock]] for steadier firing in three-round burst mode. It accepts extended 20-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]].

[[Robocop|Robocop's]] [[Auto-9]] is a modified version of this [[gun]].

h4. See also
* [[Beretta 90two]]
* [[H&K VP70]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Beretta 93R info and images":http://www.berettaweb.com/93R/Beretta%2093R%201.htm
* "Wikipedia: Beretta 93R":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beretta_93R

title: steyr_m1912
body:
The [b]Steyr M1912[/b] or [b]Steyr-Hahn[/b], is a semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] developed in 1911 by the Austrian firm "Steyr Mannlicher":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_Arms]. It was developed for the [[austria-hungary|Austro-Hungarian]] [[Army]] and adopted in 1912, becoming the standard Austro-Hungarian military handgun of [[World War I]]. The M1912 was originally chambered for the 9×23mm Steyr round. After Germany annexed Austria in 1938, the [[Wehrmacht]] ordered 60,000 units rechambered to 9×19mm Parabellum which remained in service until the end of [[World War II]].

The M1912 has integrated magazine which is situated in the grip, so feed system is by 8-round stripper [[clip (weapon)|clips]]. To [[reloading|load]], the slide is pulled back to expose the action, the clip is inserted along the guides and the [[ammunition|rounds]] pushed into the magazine. 

[b]Repetierpistole M1912/P16[/b] is the machine pistol variant which utilizes fixed 16-round integrated magazine and a [[shoulder stock]].

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Steyr M1912 pistol":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_M1912_pistol]

title: ferrari_purosangue
body: Purosangue is a high-performance SUV by Ferrari. It is Ferrari's first SUV and production 4-door vehicle.The Purosangue has a massive 6.5L V12 naturally aspirated engine from its 812 supercar,with both four-wheel drive and four-wheel steering technology.

title: battle_of_the_coral_sea
body:
One of the first battles of the Pacific theatre of operations in [[World War II]].

Fought between the [[United States]] and the [[japan|Empire of Japan]] in May 1942, it was the first naval battle between aircraft carriers and their air groups. It was fought without the [[ship]]s engaging each other directly. 

It ended in an apparent Japanese [b]tactical[/b] [[victory]], but also in a decisive, but costly, American [b]strategic[/b] [[victory]] that helped their later success during the [[Battle of Midway]].

title: squid
body:
Squid are marine cephalopods of the order Teuthida, which comprises around 300 species. Like all other cephalopods, squid have a distinct head, bilateral symmetry, a mantle, and arms. Squid, like [[cuttlefish]], have eight arms arranged in pairs and two, usually longer, [[tentacles]].

This tag is for living squid. For squid as food, see [[calamari]], [[ikayaki]], or similar.

h4. See also

* [[octopus]]
* [[calamari]]
* [[ikayaki]]
* [[Ikamusume]]
* [[cuttlefish]]

title: scarlett_(g.i._joe)
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Scarlett[/b] is a [[red hair]]ed G.I. Joe female officer expert in infiltration, [[martial_arts|hand-to-hand combat]], melee weapons and firearms. Her weapons of choice are [[shuriken]]s, mini-[[crossbow]]s and [[handgun]]s. 

She debuted as an [[action figure]] in 1982 and is considered the [b]first G.I. Joe female action figure ever released[/b].

Scarlett is portrayed by actress "Rachel Nichols":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rachel_Nichols_(actress)_ in the 2009 live-action film "G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_The_Rise_of_Cobra .

title: hakurei_shrine
body:
The primary [[shrine]] of [[Gensokyo]] in [[Touhou]] and the personal residence of [[Hakurei Reimu]].

The Hakurei Shrine sits on the border between [[Gensokyo]] and the rest of Earth proper, existing on both sides as the anchor of the Great Hakurei Barrier and accessible from either side, though the Earth-side version is said to appear old and abandoned. Outside world items appear on the grounds from time to time, but no one knows how to consciously cross from one side to the other save for [[Yakumo Yukari]] and Reimu, the latter of whom will send outsiders home if asked.

[[Ibaraki Kasen]], [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and Reimu's best friend [[Kirisame Marisa]] are frequent guests. The old turtle spirit [[Genjii (touhou)|]] and the Three Fairies of Light ([[Sunny Milk]], [[Luna Child]], and [[Star Sapphire]]) live in a spring and a tree behind the shrine, respectively. [[Mima (touhou)|]] once haunted the grounds, but has been absent from the games since the PC98 era and is only assumed to still be present. The inchling princess [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] also lived at the shrine in a converted birdcage for a period of time. [[Clownpiece]] has taken up residence in the basement since the events of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. Since becoming animate, [[Komano Aunn]] has taken it upon herself to be the shrine's guard dog. And others ([[Hinanawi Tenshi]], [[Yorigami Shion]], etc) have also taken up temporary residence over the years. The patron god of Hakurei Shrine is unknown, even to Reimu, though theories include Yukari, Mima, and [[Dragon God (Touhou)| the Great Dragon]].

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: genjii_(touhou)
body:
[[Turtle]] familiar of [[Hakurei Reimu (PC-98)|]] in the [[Touhou_(pc-98)|Touhou PC-98]] games. She originally used him as a flying mount, but he hasn't been seen since she learned how to fly on her own between [[Mystic Square]] and [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], despite ZUN's comments claiming he is retired and now lives in a spring somewhere behind [[Hakurei Shrine]]. His form is that of a turtle with prominent, gray eyebrows and a [[beard]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Genjii":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Genjii

title: makai_(touhou)
body:
The plane of demons seen in [[Touhou]] [[Mystic Square]], ruled by the devil-goddess [[Shinki (touhou)|]]. [[Elis (touhou)|]], [[Sara (touhou)|]], [[Louise (touhou)|]], [[Yuki (touhou)|]], [[Mai (touhou)|]], [[Sariel (touhou)|]], and Shinki's bodyguard/maid [[Yumeko (touhou)|]] are known residents. [[Alice Margatroid]] originally lived here, but has since moved to the [[Forest of Magic]] in [[Gensokyo]]. [[Hijiri Byakuren]] was formerly imprisoned here within a subregion known as [[Hokkai]]. And many fans speculate that [[Koakuma]] is a former resident.

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: help:frequently_asked_questions
body:
h4. Uploading

[expand=How do I upload a post?]

On the front page, click "Upload":/uploads/new in the top menu. On the upload page, either paste the link to the image, or click the upload box to upload a file from your computer.

The link doesn't have to be a direct image link. For most sites, you should paste a link to the page containing the image, rather than the image itself. For example, for Twitter and Pixiv you can paste a link to the tweet or Pixiv post, rather than a link to the image itself.

When uploading files from your computer, it's possible to upload multiple files at once by selecting them all in the file picker window. It's also possible to upload ZIP or RAR files.
[/expand]

[expand=What are the upload rules?]

Don't upload content that is poor quality, [[off-topic]], a [[paid reward]], or [[AI-generated]]. Refer to the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] for more details.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make uploading easier?]

There are a few tools that make uploading much faster and easier:

* Use the "bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet or the "Upload to Danbooru":https://github.com/danbooru/upload-to-danbooru#install browser extension to upload images in one click.
* Use the "Pixiv Image Searches and Stuff":https://github.com/nottalulah/userscripts/raw/master/Pixiv_Image_Searches_and_Stuff.user.js and "Translated Pixiv Tags":https://github.com/evazion/translate-pixiv-tags#installation userscripts to check if images have already been uploaded to Danbooru.
* Use the "Image Search Options":https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/image-search-options/kljmejbpilkadikecejccebmccagifhl browser extension to check if something has already been uploaded to Danbooru, or to find the original source.
[/expand]

[expand=How do upload limits work?]

When you first start, you can have up to 15 {{is:pending|pending}} posts in the moderation queue at once. If you hit your upload limit, you have to wait until your uploads are either approved or deleted in three days before you can upload again.

Your upload limit goes up as your uploads are approved, and goes down if your uploads are deleted. When you first start, you need 10 approvals for your upload limit to go up. Every time your limit goes up, you need 2 more approvals to get to the next level. Your limit will go down after every 3 deletions.

See [[about:upload limits]] for more details.
[/expand]

[expand=How does the moderation system work?]

All new uploads go through a moderation queue, where they're reviewed by a team of approvers. Posts have three days to be approved. If they're not approved by anyone in three days, then they're deleted.

All it takes is a single approver liking a post for it to be approved. Posts are only deleted if every approver who sees it doesn't think it's good enough to be approved. Most posts are deleted because multiple approvers saw it and none of them thought it met Danbooru's standards.

Usually there are around 10 to 15 active approvers at any given time. 
[/expand]

[expand=Why did my upload get deleted?]

Usually because it didn't meet Danbooru's quality standards. You can ask for feedback in the "Upload feedback thread":/forum_topics/7934 if you're not sure why something was deleted. Keep in mind there often isn't much to say beyond "it wasn't very good".

If you think your post was unfairly deleted, you can appeal it. Go to the deleted post, then click the "Appeal" button in the sidebar. This will put it back in the moderation queue for another three days, where it has another chance to be approved.

Keep in mind that if you appeal something immediately after it was deleted, it will probably be seen by the same people who passed over it the first time. Waiting a few days can improve your odds.
[/expand]

[expand=I don't like the moderation system]

Deleted posts can still be seen by everyone. They're simply filtered out of searches by default. To see deleted posts, add {{is:deleted}} to your searches or click the "Deleted" button in the sidebar.

If you want to always see deleted posts, you can go to your "account settings":/settings and enable the "Show deleted posts" option. This lets you effectively ignore the moderation system.
[/expand]

h4. Tagging

[expand=How do I tag a post?]

To add a tag, click the "Edit" button beneath the image and add your tags in the "Tags" box. To remove a tag, simply delete the tag from the Tags box. Click the "Submit" button when you're done. 

Anyone can add or remove tags on a post. You don't need any special privileges. All you need is to "create an account":/users/new first.

Tip: you can press "Shift+E" to quickly open the tag edit box in a window, and "Ctrl+Enter" to save the tags when you're done.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make a new character or copyright tag?]

Tag the post with [code]character:character_name_here[/code] or [code]copyright:copyright_name_here[/code]. For example, tagging a post with [code]character:hatsune_miku[/code] or [code]copyright:vocaloid[/code] would create the [[Hatsune Miku]] or [[Vocaloid]] tags (if they didn't already exist).
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make a new artist tag?]

First tag the post with [code]artist:artist_name_here[/code]. After you add the tag, a message will appear saying that you need to create a new artist entry. Click the "Create new artist entry" button, then add all the artist's profile pages to the URLs section, then click "Submit".
[/expand]

[expand=How do I rename an artist tag?]

Go to the "Artist alias request thread":/forum_topics/7713, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new?bulk_update_request[forum_topic_id]=7713 at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_artist_name -> new_artist_name[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason in the "Reason" box.
[/expand]

[expand=I'm an artist. How do I rename my artist tag?]

Go to the "Artist alias request thread":/forum_topics/7713, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new?bulk_update_request[forum_topic_id]=7713 at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_artist_name -> new_artist_name[/code] in the "Request" box.

If you can't figure it out, just post in the thread and another user will help you.
[/expand]

[expand=What is a "bulk update request"?]

A bulk update request (a BUR for short) is a forum request to change a tag or group of tags. It's a called a bulk update request because it's a request to update one or more tags in bulk.

To make a bulk update request, go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write your request in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag alias?]

An alias is an alternate name for a tag. For example, [[yellow hair]] is aliased to [[blonde hair]] because yellow hair is the same thing as blonde hair. Searching for [[yellow hair]] will automatically redirect you to [[blonde hair]]. Tagging a post with [[yellow hair]] will automatically add [[blonde hair]] instead.

An alias is used when two tags mean the same thing, or when there are multiple words people might use for the same concept.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag implication?]

An implication is when one tag automatically adds another tag. For example, the [[white shirt]] tag implies [[shirt]] because a white shirt is a type of shirt. Tagging a post with [[white shirt]] will automatically add the [[shirt]] tag too.

An implication is used when adding one tag should always add another.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I request that a tag be renamed?]
Go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_tag_name -> new_tag_name[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I request a tag alias or implication?]

Go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_tag_name -> new_tag_name[/code] or [code]imply tag1 -> tag2[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a deprecated tag?]

A deprecated tag is a tag that can't be added to new posts. Tags are deprecated when it's decided they should no longer be used, usually because they're too ambiguous, or there are other better tags available.

For example, [[case]] is deprecated because it could mean a [[suitcase]], a [[guitar case]], a [[CD case]], or some other type of case. The [[case]] tag is deprecated to prevent people from still using it.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag qualifier?]

A tag qualifier is a word in parentheses at the end of the tag, to disambiguate it from other tags with the same name. For example, in [[arrow (projectile)]] the qualifier is "projectile", to distinguish it from [[arrow (symbol)]].
[/expand]

[expand=What's a copyright tag?]

A copyright tag is a tag for a game, anime, manga, book, movie, or any other kind of fictional universe or property. In general, copyright tags are for things with characters. They're called copyright tags for lack of a better name. Copyright tags are colored purple.

Copyright tags aren't for brand names, company names, trademarks, or other things without characters.
[/expand]

h4. Users

[expand=What are the different user levels?]

Regular users are called Members. Members have blue names.

Builders have purple names. Builders are people who have been promoted for contributing a lot to the site.

Contributors also have purple names. Contributors are uploaders who have been promoted for uploading a lot of high quality posts to the site. Contributors have no upload limits and are allowed to bypass the moderation queue.

Approvers also have purple names. Approvers are in charge of approving and deleting posts.

Moderators have green names. Moderators are in charge of enforcing the rules and banning people.

Admins have red names. Admins are in charge of making site rules and dealing with bulk update requests.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I get promoted?]

You can get promoted to Builder by contributing to the site. This can be uploading, tagging, translating, being helpful in the forums, or anything else to help the site.

You can get promoted to Contributor by uploading a lot of high quality posts. Generally, the criteria is at least 750 approved posts, and a deletion rate of around 5%. Your posts should also be tagged well, and you should have a good understanding of how the site works.
[/expand]

title: butsudan
body: A household altar in Japanese [[buddhism|Buddhist]] culture, meant to provide a place to pray to the Buddha or the dead. A [i]butsudan[/i] can either take the form of a more ornate platform or, more commonly, a [[cabinet]]. When [i]butsudan[/i] are used to revere the dead, one may often find [[iei]], [[incense burner]]s, or [[candle]]s stored inside. Otherwise, they store religious icons such as [[statue]]s of the Buddha or scrolls.

As such, [[Kashtira Riseheart]] loathes this monster with a burning passion in many fan art where they're portrayed together.

title: kashtira_riseheart
body: The embodiment of [[Visas Starfrost|Visas Starfrost's]] anger and the leader of the Kashtira invaders. As such, his fanart constantly depicts him in a state of rage. He absorbs [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]] to become [[Kashtira Arise-heart]]. In fan-art, he's often angry at [[Mushroom Man #2]] because Mushroom Man #2 shuts down the Kashtira effects quite handily.

[b][[Gundam]] Mobile Suit X[/b], or [b]MS-X[/b] (エムエスエックス [i]Emuesuekkusu[/i]) for short, is a 1984 series of new [[mecha]] designs and variations of official [[mobile suit]] designs from the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] animated series. 

Just like the [[Gundam MSV]] Mobile Suit Variation (MSV) series of designs, these other mobile suit variations are all legitimate canon and were part of an original design series.

title: elena_jarvinen
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A figure skater who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She is capable of [[cryokinesis]].

Has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[light blue hair|light blue]] or [[white hair]] arranged in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Typically wears a [[blue_dress|blue]] [[figure skating dress]] and [[pantyhose]].

Her surname and nationality differ between [[Black Survival]] and [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. In the former, her surname is Lipnitskaya and she is of Russian origin; in the latter, her surname is Jarvinen and she is of Finnish origin. This difference may have been as a result of Russia's 2022 war with Ukraine.

title: tazia_(black_survival)
body:
A playable character from [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. An Italian glass artist who participates in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Known to be a perfectionist, she is able to manipulate glass via her VF powers.

Has [[red hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[medium breasts]].

title: sissela_kyle
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A Swedish hospital patient who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She suffers from an incurable disease affecting only a hundred people in the world.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and typically wears an [[eyepatch]] over her left eye. She is often seen connected to an [[intravenous drip]] via an [[iv stand]]. In [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]], she is always accompanied by a ghostly entity named [[wilson_(black_survival)|Wilson]].

title: 82nd_airborne
body:
A [[United States Army]] division created for [[World War I]], that would then become America's first Airborne Division during [[World War II]]. They saw extensive service throughout the European Theater, including North Africa, Sicily, Italy, the D-Day landings in Normandy, Holland, and the Battle of the Bulge. They are the only remaining true airborne division in the US Army today. (Their WW2-era counterparts, the [[101st Airborne]], are now an air-mobile division using helicopters, rather than an air-borne division that uses parachutes.)

Their unit patch is a blue circle in the middle of a red square background, with the letters "AA" (short for "All-American") in white in the middle. A blue crest running over the square reads "Airborne".

h4. See Also
* [[Unit Patch]]

title: dragon_ball_super
body:
The fourth [[Dragon Ball]] series created as the "definitive" sequel to [[Dragon Ball Z]], with the story being set 6 months after the defeat of [[Kid Buu]]. The anime began airing on July 5, 2015, with the manga appearing just slightly before on June 20. [[Toriyama Akira]] is credited for the "original story & character design concepts", in addition to his role as series creator, as well as providing more direct corrections and feedback for the manga. [[Toyotarou]], the Super mangaka, is also credited with "character design concepts".

Crucially, while the anime and manga follow the same base story notes provided by Toriyama, the way those notes are approached can differ significantly between the two, even when each side collaborates on select elements. While the anime has ended on March 25, 2018, with only new movies coming out since then, the manga has continued on.

[b]Directed by[/b]: Kimitoshi Chioka
[b]Produced by[/b]: [[Toei Animation]]

title: dragon_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Knight]]. Also known as the Braveheart or Dreadnought.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/ec/Dragon_Knight_Art.jpg] has her hair now predominantly black, with the exception of a large part of her bangs remaining pink. She also has dragon-like curved horns. Her outfit is mostly the same as her base class, save for her jacket now being black and the addition of black elbow-length gloves and black thighhighs. Her main summon, a white-scaled baby dragon named Astra, is seen flying beside her.

As a "Dreadnought":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/d/d4/DreadnoughtPortrait.jpg], her horns are slightly larger and her outfit now consists of a long red jacket, white skirt, black stockings, gold gauntlets and black greaves. In the background, Astra is now fully grown, covered in black scales and taking aim with its fire breath.

title: liberty_island_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the island where the [[Statue of Liberty]] is situated.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Yankee Rose.

This filly is famous for outright dominating the 2023 Triple Tiara by winning all three races and becoming the seventh Japanese Triple Tiara, the third in five years, following [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] in 2018 and [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]] in 2020.

She is a bay filly with a star and thin broken stripe marking. She can be easily distinguished by her mane fringe braid, decorated with a pompom of some sort.

title: human_tug_of_war
body:
When two or more people have a [[tug of war]] with a person's body. This is usually a fight over an uninterested person's affections.

The Pixiv equivalent tag is "大岡裁き":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/大岡裁き] ([i]Oooka Sabaki[/i], The Judgment of [i]Oooka Tadasuke[/i]). "Oooka Tadasuke":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%8Coka_Tadasuke was a highly respected Japanese Judge of the mid-Edo period. When two women claimed to be the true mother of one baby, he asked them to have a tug of war using the baby's hand, knowing that the real mother would refuse to harm the child. This fictional episode is a Japanese adaptation of the Judgment of Solomon.

If the person is only being hugged by two or more people, use [[arm hug]] instead.

title: tug_of_war

title: william_afton
body:
The overall antagonist of the [i][[Five Nights at Freddy's]][/i] franchise.

Originally introduced as a nameless Purple Man, Afton was revealed in spinoffs and eventually the main games to be [spoiler]the culprit behind the deaths of the children possessing Foxy, Chica, Bonnie, and Freddy, as well as the death of the child possessing the Puppet. Not long after the events of Five Nights 1, he accidentally kills himself wearing the malfunctioning Spring Bonnie suit, becoming the undead monstrosity [[Springtrap]]. If nothing else, Afton is determined, and will always come back when defeated. Has a daughter, [[Elizabeth Afton]], and a son, [[Michael Afton]].[/spoiler]

body:
An antagonist videogame character from [[Capcom]].

He first appeared in the [[Final Fight]] game from the 80s, and in many other fighting games since then.

[b]G. Oriber[/b] ([b]Graham Oriber[/b]) is part of the original [[Mad Gear]] gang that terrorized the streets of [[Metro City]]. He is a rotund [[bald]] man with a full dark [[beard]] and wears a white grandfather shirt with light blue pants and suspenders.

He is of Arabic descent.

body:

[b]Lor San Tekka[/b] is an old veteran space traveler and explorer. He lives in a small settlement called Tuanul located in planet [[jakku_(star_wars)|Jakku]].

Lor San Tekka first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015 and is played by [[Sweden|Swedish]]-born French actor "Max von Sydow":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_von_Sydow .

title: pl-01
body:
An experimental (and very advanced looking) Polish light battle [[tank]].

The first prototype of the [b]PL-01 Stealth Tank[/b] was created by the Polish Military University of Technology and Military Academy of Land Forces (OBRUM) with support from British defense contractor BAE Systems. The concept vehicle project was first unveiled at the International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce on September 2, 2013. A full prototype is estimated to be completed in 2016, and should the project be finalized and approved following evaluation, mass production is scheduled to begin in 2018.

The tank is operated by a crew of 3: the driver, the commander and the gunner. Despite its small size it will be armed with a 105 mm or even a 120 mm caliber main cannon and a 7.62 mm machine gun as secondary armament in an automated unmanned turret. 

The PL-01 was designed with sophisticated stealth materials and systems designed to conceal its signature from modern tank detection equipment. The entire vehicle will be also covered with radio wave absorbent material.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PL-01

title: glass_harmonica
body:
The [b]glass harmonica[/b], also known as the [b]glass armonica[/b], [b]bowl organ[/b], [b]hydrocrystalophone[/b], or simply the [b]armonica[/b] (derived from αρμονία ("harmonia"), the Greek word for harmony), is a type of musical [[instrument]] that uses a series of glass bowls or goblets graduated in size to produce musical tones by means of friction (instruments of this type are known as [i]friction idiophones[/i]).

h4. See also

* [[Instrument]]
* [[Music]]
* [[Harmonica]]
* [[Organ (instrument)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glass_harmonica

title: euphonium
body:
[b]Euphonium[/b] (from the Greek word [i]εὔφωνος[/i], meaning "well-sounding" or "sweet-voiced") is a conical-bore, baritone-voiced brass [[instrument]]. The euphonium is a valved instrument; nearly all current models are piston valved, though rotary valved models do exist.

A person who plays the euphonium is sometimes called a [i]euphoniumist[/i], [i]euphophonist[/i], or a [i]euphonist[/i], while British players often colloquially refer to themselves as [i]euphists[/i], or [i]euphologists[/i]. Similarly, the instrument itself is often referred to as [i]eupho[/i] or [i]euph[/i].

Visually, the euphonium has a similar appearance to its better known cousin, the [[tuba]], the difference being the former is slightly smaller and has a slightly higher pitch than the latter.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euphonium]
