title: sunomiya_sana
body:
Supporting character from [[Ijiranaide Nagatoro-san]].

President of the Arts Club where [[Nagatoro_hayase|Nagatoro]] and her clique gather to 'harass' [[Hachiouji Naoto|Naoto]]. She is a relative of [[Sunomiya Hana]]

[spoiler]She is a notorious [[nudist]] with [[exhibitionism|exhibitionist]] tendencies, as she simply views [[nude|nudity]] as the "perfect" form of art. A nod to [[774 (Nanashi)|Nanashi's]] pre-serialized works.[/spoiler]

title: lekain
body:
A major antagonist in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]], who also appears in [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] as a minor NPC. 

The Vice Minister of the Begnion Senate and Duke of Gaddos, he is the man responsible for the Serenes Forest Massacre and the assassination of [[Sanaki Kirsch Altina|Sanaki]]'s grandmother, Misaha. He was also arranged to marry [[Astrid (Fire Emblem)|]], until she renounced her title to escape this marriage. After [[Ashera (Fire Emblem)|]] is revived, he proclaims himself "The Chosen One," despite being unaware of how Ashera returned, ultimately being little more than a pawn for [[Sephiran (Fire Emblem)|]], the game’s main antagonist.

He has [[blonde hair]] with a short [[mustache]] that extends into [[mutton chops]], and wears white, elaborate clerical robes with red and gold trim. In [i]Path of Radiance[/i], he also wears a priest’s cap, and his robes are more simplified.

title: clarine_(fire_emblem)
body: A character from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]]. She's [[Pent (fire emblem)|]] and [[Louise (fire emblem)|]]'s daughter, and [[Klein (fire emblem)|]]'s younger sister.

title: yeou_guseul
body:
Korean for "fox bead", a [b]yeou guseul[/b] (sometimes romanized as "yeowoo guseul") is a small, marble-like ball associated with "kumiho":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kumiho, the Korean version of the [[kyuubi|nine-tailed fox]] spirit.

Often a kumiho keeps her yeou guseul in her mouth, and can use it to steal the life force of humans with a kiss.

title: future_luke
body:
A primary character in the [i][[Professor Layton]][/i] installment [i][[Professor Layton and the Unwound Future]][/i]. A version of [[Luke Triton]] from ten years into a dystopian steampunk future.

Luke has [[black eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. He usually wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[cabbie hat]], a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[open jacket|jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]], a [[green vest]], [[brown pants]], [[blue socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

[spoiler]In reality, he is [b]Clive Dove[/b] (or [b]Klaus Albatross[/b] in Japanese), a young man set on destroying London because of a disastrous time travel experiment that killed his parents.[/spoiler]

body:
A primary character from the [i][[Professor Layton]][/i] series. 
[[Hershel Layton]]'s boy assistant, and the son of Layton's longtime friend Clark Triton. He is able to communicate with animals in addition to his sharp intuition.

Luke has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[black eyes]]. He usually wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[cabbie hat]], a [[blue sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] underneath, [[suspenders hanging|hanging]] [[suspenders]], [[green shorts]], [[white socks]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. He also carries a [[brown bag|brown]] [[shoulder bag]].

He later appears in [i][[Layton's Mystery Journey]][/i] as an adult, married and a seasoned adventurer.

title: binah_(project_moon)
body:
One of the Sephirah that appears in [[Lobotomy Corporation]] and [[Library of Ruina]].

She has [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[black hair]] with [[blonde_hair|yellow]] [[streaked_hair|highlights]], which is significantly longer in LoR than in LC.
She has black eyes, a [[mole_under_eye|mole]] under her left eye, and a [[single earring]] on her left ear. She wears a black and gold [[dress]], [[fur-trimmed_coat]], and [[boots]] with a hexagonal pattern in LC. Her outfit is largely the same in LoR, save for the addition of a [[yellow brooch]], [[yellow ascot]], and [[multiple earrings|additional earring]] on her left ear.

[spoiler] Her previous identity was Garion.
A former Arbiter dispatched by the Head in order to destroy the Seed of Light Project in the Outskirts. She killed [[Kali_(project_moon)|]] but was mortally wounded in the process, allowing [[Ayin_(project_moon)|]] to capture and torture her for information before being converted into a Sephirah.

title: uchuu_senkan_yamato_2199
body:
A [[2012]] remake of the original [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] science fiction anime TV series from the [[1970s_(style)|70s]]. It is produced by [[Production IG]] and animated by [[XEBEC]].

It was released as 7 animated movies in Japanese cinemas as well as Blu-ray and DVD volumes from April 2012 onwards. The 26 episodes aired again on TV after all the volumes were released.

The new series is notable because it re-tells the events from the original series' first season, but with brand new animation techniques and more modern character, [[spacecraft]] and [[mecha]] designs. It also introduced many new female characters.

title: dragon_ball_super_super_hero
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Super Super Hero[/b] is the thirteenth movie in the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, the second to carry the [[Dragon Ball Super]] branding, as well as the fourth Dragon Ball film personally supervised by creator Toriyama Akira. 

Set following the Moro Arc, the film follows a once-more resurgent [[Red Ribbon Army]], under the command of [[Magenta (dragon ball)|]] and his confident [[Carmine (dragon ball)|]], with [[Son Gohan]] and [[Piccolo]] having to face off against opponents such as [[Dr. Hedo]]'s [[Gamma 1]] and [[Gamma 2]]. The film notably ages up some of its characters, with [[Son Goten]] and [[Trunks (dragon ball)|]] finally young adults and [[Pan (dragon ball)|]] approaching her End of Z age, and stars the usual cast alongside newcomers from the previous film, [[Dragon Ball Super Broly]].

h4. External links
* "Official site":https://2022dbs.com/

title: saine_sisters
body:
An unofficial trio of [[virtual youtuber]]s from different groups, all designed by the same artist, [[Saine]], and considering themselves 'sisters', sometimes appearing on each other's channels. The trio originally consisted of [[Kamishiro Kurea]] (formerly [[Otogi Resurrection]], now [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]]), [[Sephira Su]] ([[Fensi]]) and [[Suzuhara Lulu]] ([[Nijisanji]]), until 2021, when Su retired in January and Lulu in June of that year.

Since then, Kurea has been joined by fellow indies [[Hoshikage Lapis]] and [[Watagashi Unou]], as the new Saine Sisters.

body:

The original 6-episode web series was gradually produced and then released on YouTube between 2011 and 2016 and has proven very popular, with each episode having at least 20 million views as of 2021. A TV series was aired on Channel 4 with the 1st season airing from 30 September, 2022 to 14 October, 2022.

title: archer_(clash_of_clans)
body:
The [[Archer (Clash of Clans)]] is a single-target ranged troop unlocked with a level 2 Barracks.
She is the first ranged troop unlocked in the Barracks, and the second overall troop unlocked in the game.

The Archer is a female warrior with sharp eyes. She wears a short, light green dress, a hooded cape, a leather belt, and an attached small pouch. She is always barefoot, including all her skins. She has a quiver slung on her back, a gold short bow in her left hand, and a golden band on each of her upper arms.

h4. External links

* "Fandom: Archer":[https://clashofclans.fandom.com/wiki/Archer]

title: archer_queen_(clash_of_clans)

She is the second Hero, being unlocked at Town Hall 9.

title: altaria
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #334 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Dragon/Flying Pokémon.
Altaria is a blue, phoenix-like Pokémon. Its body and cloud-like wings are covered in fluffy, white feathers. It often folds its wings behind it, obscuring its back.

It evolves from [[Swablu]] and with the [i]Altarianite[/i] it can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Altaria]].
Japanese Name: [b]Tyltalis[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Swablu]]
Next Pokémon: [[Zangoose]]

title: different_reflection
body:
When something in the [[reflection]] in a [[mirror]] or any reflective surface does not match up with what viewers realistically expect, for instance showing a character's [[dual persona]].

If the reflected image is different due to an [[artistic error]], then use [[bad reflection]] instead. If the reflected image is different because it doesn't show the character's reflection, use [[no reflection]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[augmented reality]]
* [[different shadow]]
* [[dual persona]]
* [[revealing layer]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: missing_finger
body:
Missing a finger due to [[artistic error]] or violent removal. Not for characters who normally have less than 5 fingers as part of their character design, such as [[furry|furries]], [[monster girl]]s, aliens, or cartoon characters.

h4. See also

* [[fewer digits]]
* [[severed finger]]

title: lazy_eye
body:

title: no_wings
body:
Use this tag when a winged character is depicted without wings. This can be an [[artistic error]] (e.g. a character is drawn with wings in all but one panel of a comic) or a stylistic choice by the artist. 

When a winged character tries to hide the wings, but you still catch a glimpse of them use [[wings_hidden]]. 


h4. See also 

* [[wings_hidden]]

title: black_teeth
body:
Blackening of teeth was practiced in Japan since the Kofun period (3rd century) for health and aesthetic purposes, with the practice dying out in the early 20th century.

Depictions making their way to Danbooru may be [[artistic error]]s due to miscoloration by the artist. Characters most likely to be intentionally depicted with black teeth may be [[kitsune]], [[geisha]], or [[oiran]].

title: bad_reflection
body:
A specific type of [[artistic error]] where the [[reflection]] in a [[mirror]] (or other reflective surface) doesn't match up with what it should be.

If the reflected image is different [b]on purpose[/b], then use [[different_reflection]].

title: upside-down_penis
body: When the frenulum of the penis is on the opposite side of the penis from the scrotum making the head look upside-down. This may be an [[artistic error]] or otherwise intentional.

title: ishi_no_hana
body:
Manga by [[Sakaguchi Hisashi]], running from 1983 to 1986, set during [[World War II]]-era [[Yugoslavia]]. The title, rendered in Serbo-Croatian as 'Kameni cvet / Камени цвет', references the Stone Flower monument which serves as a reminder of the atrocities committed at the Jasenovac concentration camp. The manga would see renewed interest in the 90s, as a source of knowledge for readers contextualizing the then-ongoing Yugoslav Wars.

Editions of the manga after the 80s Ushio Publishing releases (ex. Shinchosha) would feature extensive redraws, which has some fans split. The 2022 Kadokawa-published editions, based on the Shinchosha editions, would feature as a bonus two earlier chapters made by Sakaguchi adapting the 1969 Yugoslav film '"Krvava bajka":[https://www.filmneweurope.com/news/serbia-news/item/123557-serbian-classic-sold-for-comic-book-adaptation-in-japan]', published in the August and September 1970 issues of Manga-Ou, which are considered the origin of Ishi no Hana's eventual creation. Despite the subject matter, the manga has only ever been released outside of Japan in French as 'Fleur de pierre,' and awareness of the manga in former Yugoslavia is sparse but growing.

h4. External link
* Wikipedia: "Ishi no Hana (Sakaguchi Hisashi manga)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E3%81%AE%E8%8A%B1_(%E5%9D%82%E5%8F%A3%E5%B0%9A%E3%81%AE%E6%BC%AB%E7%94%BB)] (Japanese)
* MangaHelpers: "Ishi no Hana":https://mangahelpers.com/m/ishi-no-hana
* MyAnimeList: "Ishi no Hana":https://myanimelist.net/manga/18669/Ishi_no_Hana
* "Sample of the first three chapters":[https://note.com/aokishi/n/n6e80bcdcd65e] (Japanese)

title: mai_natsume
body:
Mai Natsume is the protagonist of the manga [[BlazBlue Remix Heart]] and [[BlazBlue Variable Heart]], illustrated by [[Sumeshi (ambivalince)|]], as well as of two side-stories in [[Blazblue: Chronophantasma|BlazBlue Chronophantasma Extend]] and appears as a playable character in [[Blazblue: Central Fiction]]. She's voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] in Japanese, and [[Stephanie Sheh]] in English.

She was a classmate and friend of [[Noel Vermillion]], [[Tsubaki Yayoi]], [[Makoto Nanaya]], [[Kajun Faycott]] and [[Shiori Kirihito]] during their time at the Military Academy. After leaving the academy Mai worked for [[Kokonoe (blazblue)|]] at Sector Seven.

Mai is the vessel of the Nameless Grimoire, which allows her to read people's thoughts or memories or obtain information about objects by tasting them. Her true name is Mai Hazuki and she's the heir of the Hazuki Family, one of the twelve noble families that govern the world. Shortly prior to the events of Remix Heart, the Nameless Grimoire inadvertently fused with her body and transformed Mai from a boy into girl. She was not able to reverse the transformation and her father sent her to the Torifune Military Academy under an alias. While Mai initially wanted to return to her previous form, she eventually became female in both body and mind, came to accept her new form and now considers herself to be a woman.

Mai was given a powerful magic spear called [[Outseal]] by Kajun in Variable Heart, that she used ever since as her preferred weapon.

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[blue hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[huge breasts]].

As Mai's own media almost always portrays her in female form, she only warrants the [[genderswap_(mtf)]] tag for pics that include her male form or otherwise allude to her originally being male. See topic #11614 for details.

title: black_knight_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]

Mysterious General from Daein's Army, he is known for the Jet-Black Armor he uses in combat that covers his body completely, which is said to be blessed by Tellius' Goddess, making it resistent to conventional weapons.

His weapon of choice is [[Alondite]], a legendary two-handed sword.

[spoiler]His true identity is [[Zelgius (Fire Emblem)|]], a Begnion general loyal to [[Sephiran (Fire Emblem)|]][/spoiler]

title: m26_pershing
body:
First conceived as a heavy [[tank]] during the later stages of [[World War II]], the M26 Pershing saw service near the end of the war in Europe, destroying just 7 German tanks. It later served in the Korean War alongside [[M4 Sherman|M4A3 'Easy Eight' Shermans]], fighting off [[T-34|T-34/85s]] and emerging on the winning side.

Although its military career was short lived, if it weren't for this vehicle, the [[M46 Patton]], as well as the subsequent [[M47 Patton|M47]], [[M48 Patton|M48]] or [[M60 Patton]] wouldn't even exist...

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "M26 Pershing":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M26_Pershing

title: karl_gerat
body:
"Karl-Gerät" (Karl-device), also known as Mörser Karl, was a [[World War II]] German self-propelled siege [[mortar (weapon)|mortar]]. Its heaviest munition was a 60 cm (24 in) diameter, 2,170 kg (4,780 lb) shell, and the range for its lightest shell of 1,250 kg (2,760 lb) was just over 10 km (6.2 mi). Each gun had to be accompanied by a crane, a heavy transport trailer, and several modified tanks to carry shells.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Karl-Gerät":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl-Gerät

title: kampfer
body:
[i]For the [[mecha]] from [[Gundam 0080]], see [[Kampfer (Mobile Suit)]].[/i]

[b]Kämpfer[/b] (German for "Fighter") is a light novel series by Tsukiji Toshihiko, with illustrations by [[Senmu (senmudayo)|]]. The series contains 15 volumes published by [i]Media Factory[/i] under their [i]MF Bunko J[/i] imprint between November 2006 and March 2010. The main series covers 12 volumes, while the remaining three are short story collections. A manga adaptation by [[Tachibana Yuu]] started serialization in the April 2008 issue of [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i]. A 12-episode anime adaptation aired in Japan between October and December 2009 on [i]TBS[/i], concluded in spring 2011 with [i]Kämpfer für die Liebe[/i]. The series has extensive use of the German language.

h4. Plot

[[Senou Natsuru]] discovered that he can morph into a female fighter (Kämpfer) after receiving a plush doll gift from his friend, [[Sakura Kaede]]. Suddenly, he discovered himself in a deadly fight between Kämpfers. The party responsible for the fight is rumored to be as Moderators and they are mysterious.

h4. Characters

title: is-2
body:
The [b]IS tank[/b] (or [b]Iosif Stalin Tank[/b]) was a series of heavy [[tank]]s developed as a successor to the [[KV-2|KV-series]] by the [[Soviet]] Union during [[World War II]]. It was named after Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]]. 

The heavy tank was designed with a very thick armor to counter the German 88 mm guns, and carried a very powerful main gun that was capable of defeating the German [[Tiger I]] and [[Panther (tank)|]] tanks in one shot. 

Because of its low mobility and speed it was mainly a breakthrough tank, firing a heavy high-explosive shell that was useful against heavy fortifications like entrenchments and bunkers.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "IS-2":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IS_tank_family#IS-2
* GuP website: "IS-2m M1944":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_is2.html

title: panther_(tank)
body:
A medium [[tank]] deployed by [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] in [[World War II]] from mid-1943 to the end of the European war in 1945. It was intended as a counter to the [[Soviet]] [[T-34]], and as a replacement for the [[Panzer III]] and [[Panzer IV]]. While never replacing the latter, it served alongside it and the heavier [[Tiger I]] until the end of the war.

Until 1944, it was designated as the [b]Panzerkampfwagen V Panther[/b] and had the ordnance inventory designation of Sd.Kfz. 171. On 27 February 1944, [[Adolf Hitler]] ordered that the Roman numeral V be deleted from the designation.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panther tank":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panther_tank

title: panzer_i
body:
The first of the mass produced German [[tank]]s of the interwar period, mainly as a training model for both military and industrial known-how.

Armed with only [[machine gun]]s and small in size, the type was not expected to be used in actual combat. Despite this the type served as the backbone of the German Panzer divisions in the early campaigns of [[World War II]]. The hull of the design was later used for various self-propelled guns and other support vehicles.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer I":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_I

title: panzer_ii
body:
The second major mass produced [[tank]] of Germany during the interwar period. A rather light design armed with autocannon and [[machine gun]]s. Mainly designed for training but went on to serve as the backbone of the Panzer forces during the early campaigns of [[World War II]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer II":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_II

title: panzer_iv
body:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen IV[/b] (Pz.Kpfw. IV), commonly known as the [b]Panzer IV[/b], was a medium [[tank]] developed in [[Nazi]] Germany in the late 1930s and used extensively during [[World War II]]. Its ordnance inventory designation was Sd.Kfz. 161.

Designed as an infantry-support tank, the Panzer IV was not originally intended to engage enemy armor—that function was performed by the lighter [[Panzer III]]. However, with the flaws of pre-war doctrine becoming apparent and in the face of [[Soviet]] [[T-34]] tanks, the Panzer IV soon assumed the tank-fighting role of its increasingly obsolete cousin. The most widely manufactured and deployed German tank of the Second World War, the Panzer IV was used as the base for many other fighting vehicles, including the [[Sturmgeschutz IV]] assault gun, [[Jagdpanzer IV]] tank destroyer, the Wirbelwind self-propelled anti-aircraft weapon, and the Brummbär self-propelled gun.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer IV":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_IV

title: maus_(tank)
body:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus[/b] ("Mouse") was a German [[World War II]] super-heavy [[tank]] prototype design completed in late 1944.

It is the heaviest fully enclosed armored fighting vehicle ever built. The complete vehicle was 10.2 metres (33 ft 6 in) long, 3.71 metres (12 ft 2 in) wide and 3.63 metres (11.9 ft) high. Weighing 188 metric tons, the Maus's main armament was the Krupp-designed 128 mm KwK 44 L/55 gun, based on the 12.8 cm Pak 44 anti-tank field artillery piece also used in the casemate-type [[Jagdtiger]] [[tank destroyer]], with a coaxial 75 mm KwK 44 L/36.5 gun. The 128 mm gun was powerful enough to destroy all Allied armored fighting vehicles then in service, some at ranges exceeding 3,500 metres (3,800 yd).

However, the vehicle's extreme weight meant that it was ridiculously slow and impractical, being a perfect target for bombing runs by aircraft. In addition, it was a logistical nightmare, needing absurd amounts of fuel and being difficult to maintain and repair. If fielded in large numbers, it would most likely not have had any significant effect on the war effort due to its complete unsuitability for the mobile, air-dominated battlefield. Only two prototypes were constructed, the first of which did not have an actual turret. The second prototype had its hull destroyed by the Germans to prevent Russian forces from capturing it. The surviving Maus in Kublinka tank museum today is the turret from the second prototype on the hull of the first prototype.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_VIII_Maus

title: panzer_iii
body:
A medium [[tank]] that was developed in the 1930s by Germany and was used extensively in [[World War II]].

The official German designation was Panzerkampfwagen III Sd Kfz. 141 (abbreviated PzKpfw III or Panzer III) translating as "armored fighting vehicle". It was intended to fight other armored fighting vehicles and serve alongside the infantry-supporting [[Panzer IV]]. However, as the Germans faced the formidable [[T-34]], stronger anti-tank guns were needed. The Panzer IV had a bigger turret ring and so the roles were reversed. The Panzer IV mounted the long barreled 7.5 cm KwK 40 gun and engaged in tank-to-tank battles. The Panzer III became obsolete in this role and for most purposes was supplanted by the Panzer IV. From 1942, the last version of Panzer III mounted the 7.5 cm KwK 37 L/24, better suited for infantry support.

Production of the Panzer III ended in 1943. However, the Panzer III's capable chassis provided hulls for the [[Sturmgeschutz III]] until the end of the war.

h4. See also


* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer III":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_III

title: su-122
body: A Soviet self-propelled howitzer of World War II.  The SU-122 was inspired by the German [[sturmgeschutz iii|Sturmgeschütz III]] assault gun, which is the chassis of a [[panzer iii|Panzer III]] tank with a heavy gun in a turretless hull, principally intended to attack bunkers and other fixed positions.  The SU-122 is a similar concept executed on the chassis of a [[T-34]].  As its name suggests, it carries a 122mm howitzer.

title: 7tp
body: The standard tank of the Polish Army during the 1939 Invasion of Poland. A development of the British Vickers 6-Ton, it was armed with a 37mm cannon which made it significantly better armed than its most common opponents, the [[panzer i|Panzer I]] and [[panzer ii|Panzer II]].

title: harvestmen
body:
[[Arachnid]]s from the order Opiliones.  Also known as harvesters, harvest spiders, or daddy longlegs.  They're particularly remembered for their many species that possess very long slender legs.  A harvestmen's body appears as a single oval-shape and they have a single pair of eyes. Spiders in comparison have a clear separation of their two body parts and possess 3-4 pairs of eyes.  Harvestmen feed on small insects and plant matter, and can consume solid food.  This is unlike spiders which can only consume liquid food.

Urban legend has that harvestmen possess extremely deadly poison, but have fangs to short to penetrate human skin.  Despite this claim, no known harvestmen species possesses venom and all lack the fangs necessary to inject venom.  Instead of fangs they possess tiny little gripper claws, that are too small to penetrate human skin.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Opiliones":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opiliones]

title: camel_spider
body:
An [[arachnid]] order known as the Solifugae, characterized by its large chelicerae (mouthparts). Camel spiders also feature what looks like 5-pairs of legs, though the the first pair are pedipalps instead of legs and are used as a set of feelers.  The first pair of real legs are also used as feelers and are typically smaller and thinner than the rear 3 pairs of legs used for walking.

Note that the Solifugae and Araneae (common [[spider]]s) are from different orders.



h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solifugae 
* [[list of animals]]

title: whip_scorpion
body:
A group of arachnids belonging to the order of Uropygi.  They possess [[scorpion]]-like pincers, a long whip-like tail, eight legs; six legs for walking and their front most two legs for feelers.  They do no possess venom glands, but do have glands near the rear of their abdomen that produce a combination of acids which they can spray when they're bothered.

Their naming comes from their similarity to true scorpions, but they're more closely related to [[spider]]s.

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Uropygi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uropygi]

title: coca-cola_polar_bear
body:
Mascot characters for [[Coca-Cola]].  They're fictional [[polar bear]]s that drink Coca-Cola and have been repeat mascot characters since 1993.  Besides the classic glass Coca-Cola bottles they drink from, they're usually identifiable by the [[red scarf]] or red-white [[striped scarf]] some of them wear.  The red scarf is best identifiable when it has the Coca-Cola logo on it.  

These bears should be identified from other polar bear characters by their association with Coca-Cola products and branding, and should not be used for polar bear characters simply wearing a red scarf.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Coca-Cola Polar Bears":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coca-Cola_polar_bears]

title: verxina_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Russian: "Peak, top, summit"[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Halwa Sweet (a racemare known for having no tail except for the very base).

She is a contemporary of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and [[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] and was the latter's fiercest rival in their classic races as she consistently finished second in the Triple Tiara, even almost winning the Shuka Sho, only losing by a nose. Verxina gained fame by being a double winner of the Victoria Mile.

She is the elder sister of [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]] and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]].

Later became a running gag of the series.

title: shark_penis
body:
Male [[shark]] reproductive organ, also known as "claspers".

While called a "[[penis]]" here, the shark's claspers are specially adapted fins which are used to anchor the male shark to a female shark during mating.
Unlike a typical penis, claspers are not involved in the insemination process, lack a urethra, and do not ejaculate.

She is a [[fox girl]] with [[blue hair|blue]], [[long hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. To match those colours, she wears a [[blue choker|blue]] [[star choker]] and a [[blue sweater|blue]], [[off-shoulder sweater]]. She has [[multiple tails|6]] [[blue tail|blue]] [[fox tail|fox tails]]

title: antispiral
body:
The final antagonist in the anime [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]], the being known as 'Anti-Spiral' is the collective mentality of the Anti-Spiral race.

* Visually, Anti-Spiral resembles a black humanoid silhouette, with a white, sketchy outline, large round eyes and a small T-shaped mouth.
* The homeworld of the Anti-Spiral race is located on a separate dimension, whose laws of physics Anti-Spiral is capable of manipulating.
* During the final battle against the Gurren Brigade, Anti-Spiral piloted the [[Grand Zamboa]].

title: kama_(mistake)_(fate)
body:
An Archer-class variant of [[Kama (Fate)|]], who debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] as an exclusive servant.

This variant of Kama is notable for dressing as a [[maid]] in her 2nd Ascension, and for having a unique 3rd Ascension despite her 1st Ascension being nearly identical to her Assassin-class variant on the mobile version. Also unlike her Assassin-class variant, she does not [[aged up|age up]] as she ascends. She is called Kama (Mistake) as she had intended to end up in the mobile game's version of Chaldea, but ended up in the Arcade version of Chaldea instead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[ReDrop]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Shitaya Noriko]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Kama (Mistake)":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Kama_(Mistake)

title: g_(genesis1556)
body:
Artist.

Nickname: "G"

h4. Original characters

* [[Annes (g (genesis1556))|Annes]]: Blue-themed dragon girl with a stoic demeanor, [[one-eyed|one eye]], and often carrying an [[ootachi]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Dein.
* [[Arisa (g (genesis1556))|Arisa]]: Yellow-themed dragon girl with two extendable barbed spearlike organs growing from the tip of her tail. Has a lesbian crush on Annes.
* [[Dein (g (genesis1556))|Dein]]: Red-themed dragon girl with a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often wearing a [[fur-trimmed coat]] and [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] or [[cigar]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Annes.
* [[Karutia (g (genesis1556))|Karutia]]: Green-themed dragon girl who is an old friend of Tsubasa Ryuuji. [[Bisexual]] and often drawn provocatively.
* [[Rara (g (genesis1556))|Rara]]: Dragon girl with whitish-pink hair and a younger appearance than the others. Initially portrayed as having a [[yandere]] crush on Rio.
* [[Leia (g (genesis1556))|Leia]]: Pink-themed dragon girl and the most openly sexual of G's characters, with an incestuous attraction to her brother Rio.
* [[Lily (g (genesis1556))|Lily]]: "Dark" version of Lala with [[dark skin]], [[heterochromia]], and flower [[tattoo]]s.
* [[Lutian (g (genesis1556))|Lutian]]: Icy-blue-themed dragon girl with [[yellow eyes]] and a stern demeanor.
* [[Meldine (g (genesis1556))|Meldine]]: Blue-and-white themed dragon girl starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where she seduces Shota-kun.
* [[Miguel (g (genesis1556))|Miguel]]: Dragon boy with grey-brown hair and fur covering his arms, sexually assertive, and has an attraction to Rio's gender-bent form.
* [[Mia (g (genesis1556))|Mira]]: Black-themed dragon girl with red eyes, shows little emotion.
* [[Rio (g (genesis1556))|Rio]]: Black-and-white-themed dragon boy, often subject to the advances of G's other dragon girls, frequently caught in the middle of the local cetaceans' brawls, and sometimes gender-bent.
* [[Ryuuga (g (genesis1556))|Ryuuga]]: Black-themed dragon girl with similarities to Dein, possessing a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often drawn wearing an open coat and [[smoking]]. Unlike Dein, she has [[dark skin]] and prefers to smoke a [[smoking pipe|pipe]].
* [[Shota-kun (g (genesis1556))|Shota-kun]]: A young, brown-themed dragon boy starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where he is seduced by Meldine.
* [[Tsubasa Ryuuji]]: An [[original]] [[female admiral (kancolle)|]] and star of "Half Dragon Admiral":/pools/9099.

title: mokuren
body:
[i][[Boku no Chikyuu o Mamotte]][/i] character.

Mokuren was one of the alien scientist protagonists, as well as the past life of Alice Sakaguchi. Her distinguishing marks are a forehead symbol similar to a stylized flower with four petals and long blond hair.

She now has three [[fox tail]]s that she also gained through ascension. Her animations also change, relying more on magic rather than attacking the enemy directly with her other two Ascensions.

title: tamamo_no_mae_(fate/extra)
body:
Selectable Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Extra]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. Also one of the Servants of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The "core" (i.e main body) of the "[[Tamamo (fate)|]] nine" servants who were split from [[Amaterasu (fate)|]].

She's a magical [[fox girl]] who uses a [[mirror]] as her [[weapon]], has [[pink hair]], [[yellow eyes]], dressed in stylized traditional blue [[japanese clothes|japanese robes]], often has [[split ponytail]] hairstyle with [[blue bow]]. 
Her theme name is "Caster: Extra Life With Whoever She Wants".

Designed by [[Wada Arco]] and [[Takeuchi Takashi]], and voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].

title: tamamo_(fate)
body:
Catchall tag that includes all versions of Tamamo (or specifically the Tamamo nine servants) from the [[Fate (series)|]] series.

The [b]Tamamo nine[/b] were a group of nine [[fox girl]] servants first debuted in [[Fate/Extra]]. They were created after the goddess [[Amaterasu (fate)|]] cut off her nine tails which later gained consciousness of their own.

So far, five [spoiler](four if not counting the "fake" Tamamo)[/spoiler] out of nine Tamamos have made their appearance in the Fate series:
* [[Tamamo no Mae (fate/extra)|]]
* [[Koyanskaya (fate)|]]/Tamamo Vitch
* [[Tamamo Cat (fate)|]]
* [[Tamamo no Mae (JK) (fate)|Tamamo JK]]
* [[Tamamo Aria (fate)|]]

title: tamamo_aria_(fate)
body:
A stray Rider-class Servant from [[Fate/Samurai Remnant]]. One of the [[tamamo (fate)|Tamamo nine]], the tails that separated from [[tamamo no mae (fate/extra)|Tamamo no Mae]] in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and became their own individuals.

Just like the other Tamamo, she has a similar default kimono, which in her case is colored yellow (her sketch in Fate/Extra Material had it as brown). However, she looks comparatively younger than them. She wields a long Japanese sword.

title: tamamo_no_mae_(swimsuit_lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[tamamo no mae (fate/extra)| Tamamo no Mae]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]] for the 2016 Summer Event. She wears a [[blue bikini]] [[bikini under clothes|underneath]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]], a [[straw hat]], an [[innertube]] for her tail, and a [[towel]] that bears her name. Her weapon is a [[parasol]] thereby classifying her as a Lancer.

The bikini and wet t-shirt combination that she wears in her Second Ascension was later released as a DLC costume in [[Fate/Extella Link]], given the name [b]Beach Flower[/b].

Do not add the [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)]] tag if Tamamo Lancer is by herself. They are treated as separated characters and should only be tagged together if they both appear in an image, or one is [[cosplay]]ing as the other.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

h4.Ascensions

* [[tamamo no mae (swimsuit lancer) (first ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]]
* [[tamamo no mae (swimsuit lancer) (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]]
* [[tamamo no mae (swimsuit lancer) (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]

body:

She has [[blue eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[blue bow|blue]] [[bow]], [[blue cardigan|blue]] [[cardigan]] on top of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]]. She also wears [[glasses]] during class as well as maybe a [[blazer]].

At the [[beach]] she stylizes her hair in a [[ponytail]] and wears a [[blue bikini]].

title: chiem_(vtuber)
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]] and the virtual avatar of artist [[chiem]]. Her emoji is 🤍.

Chiem's overall appearance is designed after a [[fallen angel]]-motif. She has [[grey hair]] and two black 'ear [[feathered wings]]'. Her usual outfit consists of a silver dress, a red [[necktie]] and a black and white [[hairband]]. She wears [[uneven legwear]] and [[boots]] (see post #5579533).

Chiem is a quiet and soft-spoken individual. Usually she keeps her stream as wholesome as possible; however, once a certain 'switch' is flipped, certain changes in her personality can be easily spotted. She keep a calm composure whenever she plays Visual Novels (due to being a hardcore professional of this genre), but fumbles around during FPS or Survival game streams to the point of being entirely helpless.

title: spartan_(destroid)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982.

The [b]Centinental/Kransmann MBR-07-Mk II Spartan[/b] [[destroid]] is a main [[battle]] [[robot]] system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]].

This is a heavy armored and armed mecha. It has two launchers with several [[missile]]s for long to mid range attacks, as well as a concealed gun cluster in its torso with a [[flamethrower]], a [[grenade launcher]], a [[machine gun]] and an [[energy cannon]]. 

Besides its ranged weapons the mecha also possess two powerful manipulators (hands) designed to rip through the armor of most Zentradi mecha. It can also be equipped with a heavy [[baton]] for [[giant]] [[maclone]] riot control.

In [[real life]] the Spartan was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.
other_names: デストロイド・スパルタン

title: shroud_(sailing)
body:
A set of cables or ropes that keeps the ship's mast in its place.
The shrouds also serve as ladders to permit the crew to climb aloft.

title: gnerl
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[starfighter]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]Fighter Pod[/b] (空戦ポッド, [i]kuusen pod[/i]) is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace attack [[spacecraft]] designed for outer space and atmospheric operations. It is very fast, highly maneuverable and also armed with a triple-barreled energy cannon on its nose and several internal missile bays. 

In the TV show, its official name is obscure. But judging from some Zentradi operator's quote in [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]]'s spaceship, it's called [b]Gnerl[/b] (ジナール). In Artdink's [[PlayStation 3]] [[ video game]], "”MACROSS 30: Ginga wo Tsunagu Utagoe”,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macross_30:_The_Voice_that_Connects_the_Galaxy the starfighter is officially called "Gnerl".

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4.See also
* "Gnerl Fighter Pod Image":https://macross.fandom.com/wiki/Gnerl?file=Gnerl.gif

title: super_neo_metal_sonic
body: Super Neo Metal Sonic, also known simply as Super Neo Metal, is a transformation that appears in the [[Sonic the Hedgehog (IDW)|]] comic series and its spin-offs published by IDW Publishing. It is the Super State of [[Neo Metal Sonic]], achieved through powering up with the [[Master Emerald]].

title: gundam_battle_operation_2
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: Battle Operation 2[/b] is a free-to-play team battle and [[mecha]] action online multiplayer [[video game]] developed by "B.B. Studio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B.B._Studio and published by [[Bandai]] [[Namco]] Entertainment. The game is set in the [[Gundam]] universe.

The player is a [[mobile suit]] pilot member of the P.M.U. (Private Military Union) mercenary group and fights in missions and battles using several different mecha from the Gundam U.C. (Universal Century) era. 

Battle Operation 2 was released for Personal [[Computer]]s and the [[PlayStation 4]] home console in 2018, and was later ported to the [[PlayStation 5]]. It is still active to this day.

The PS4 version is notable because it's one of the few online multiplayer titles in that system that can be played completely for free without the need of purchasing a [i]PlayStation Plus[/i] subscription service.

h4. Some original Non-Playable Characters (NPC) from the game
* [[Neidhardt Heidegger]]
* [[Tenda Begin]]
* [[Carrie Kadbury]]
* [[Oldem Koda]]
* [[Katarina Wenders]]
* [[Leona Lucraft]]

title: super_silver

title: neidhardt_heidegger
body:
A fictional NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Neidhardt Heidegger[/b] is the grumpy, tall, bald and rude looking manager of the Private Military Union (P.M.U.) Base Camp, and [[Tenda Begin]]'s adoptive father. Neidhardt is responsible for giving the players their mission rewards.

title: tenda_begin
body:
A fictional female underage NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Tenda Begin[/b] was orphaned during an unspecified war and was adopted by [[Neidhardt Heidegger]]. She is in charge of assigning the player's training missions.

title: leona_lucraft
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Leona Lucraft[/b] is an expert [[mobile suit]] mechanic and workaholic that, despite her relatively young age, has an expansive career working with machinery, dating back to when she was a child. She works at the P.M.U. Hangar and is in charge of upgrading the player's [[mecha]].

title: katarina_wenders
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Katarina Wenders[/b] is a provocatively dressed [[blonde hair]]ed woman who runs the Supply Counter.

title: carrie_kadbury
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Carrie Kadbury[/b] is a somewhat shy and modest bespectacled young woman who runs the Mission Counter. She is responsible for assigning pilots missions and helping them get ready to sortie. She also acts as a communications operator for pilots during missions.

title: oldem_koda
body:
A fictional NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Oldem Koda[/b] is a stoic, bespectacled man responsible for assigning players ranks and promotions.

body: [[Pandora_(kid_icarus)|Pandora]]'s true form. She transforms in [[kid_icarus_uprising|Kid Icarus: Uprising]] upon entering the Rewind Spring after hiding in [[Dark Pit]]'s wings, which granted him unlimited flight capability.

body: Antagonist character from the [[Kid Icarus]] series, the goddess of disaster and calamity. She is portrayed as a large [[blue_fire|blue fireball]] until she achieves her [[amazon_pandora|real form]].

title: stitches
body:
Tag used to describe visible thread-holdings on clothing or ones body, you will often see this on [[stuffed animal|stuffed animals]] and [[zombie|zombies]] too. It has a distinctive train track look or appear as X's going in a line.

Sutures (also known as stitches) are used to hold skin and all other tissues of the human body together, after someone has been injured or went through surgery. This is done with a [[needle]] and preformed by a [[doctor]] or [[nurse]].

Not to be confused with [[stitched]].

h4. See also

* [[Patchwork Skin]]

title: grand_zamboa
body:
* [b]Japanese:[/b]（グランゼボーマ）[Guranzeboma]

A mecha piloted by the [[Antispiral|Anti-Spiral]] during the last episode of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]. It was created to battle the [[Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann (mecha)|Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] mecha on even grounds.

* Visually, it resembles a black, skeletal version of Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann.
* On the same way that Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann is a manifestation of [[Spiral Power]], Grand Zamboa is a manifestation of "absolute despair".
* Despite being an Anti-Spiral machine, it is capable of using drills as weapons; however, instead of having spiral grooves, the grooves are straight from the tip of the drill to its base.

title: burning_blaze
body: A transformation that appears in the [[Sonic Rush]] and [[Sonic Rush Adventure]]. It is the super transformation of [[Blaze the Cat]], achieved by harnessing the power of the seven [[Sol Emerald]]s.

title: hyper_sonic
body: A transformation that appears in the [[Sonic the Hedgehog 3|Sonic 3]] [[Sonic & Knuckles|& Knuckles]]. It is the Hyper State of [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], achieved by harnessing the power of the seven Super Emeralds, the enhanced versions of the [[Chaos Emerald]]s.

title: the_noid
body: A mascot for [[Domino's Pizza]] in the 1980s. He was a manifestation of the challenges in Dominos' famous "30 minutes or it's free" delivery policy.

title: domino's_pizza
body:
An American chain of [[pizza]] restaurants founded in 1960. A regular part of its ad campaign is the 30-minute guarantee that started from 1973 to 1993, stating that customers would receive their delivered pizzas within 30 minutes or it was free but ended the practice in 1993 due to many car accidents and deaths caused by Dominos delivery drivers trying to reach their destination quickly.

h4.See also

* [[The Noid]]
* [[Pizza Hut]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: jack_in_the_box_(restaurant)
body: An American fast-food restaurant chain founded February 21, 1951, by Robert O. Peterson in San Diego, California, where it is headquartered. Menu items include a variety of chicken tenders, [[french fries]], [[burger|burgers]], and selections of internationally themed foods such as tacos and egg rolls. Their mascot is [[Jack Box]].

title: the_king_(burger_king)
body:
The mascot of [[Burger King]]. Originally known as "The Burger King", he became just "The King" following the introduction of his most famous iteration in 2004. This iteration appeared in costume form with an oversized full-face grinning mask, often appearing in various unexpected places to offer people Burger King food.

Due to the mask making him fall in the uncanny valley, he may be seen as creepy. As a result, he has been used less since 2011, but still makes appearances every now and again.

title: takamura_koutarou_(bungou_to_alchemist)
other_names: 高村光太郎(文豪とアルケミスト)

title: tortoise
body:
[b]Tortoises[/b] are terrestrial [[turtle]]s. They frequently have higher domed [[shell]]s than turtles, as living on land means they do not need to be streamlined for [[swimming]], and thicker legs to support their weight.

h4. See also

title: manuel_noriega
body:
Manuel Antonio Noriega Moreno (February 11, 1934 - May 29, 2017) was a [[panama|Panamanian]] dictator (from 1983 to 1989) and military officer, as well as a former intelligence source for the [[CIA]]. 
His violent leadership and growing involvement in drug-trafficking and money laundering eventually led the [[united_states|American]] goverment to launch an invasion on Panama in 1989 with the objective of capturing him.

Washing cars by hand is also frequently used as a means of fund raising, particularly in the US, where volunteers will wash cars in exchange for donations. Some of these car washes may feature women in [[bikini]]s to draw in more people, such car washes are referred to as a bikini car wash.

title: data_east
body:
[b]Data East Corporation[/b] (株式会社データイースト [i]Dēta Īsuto Kabushikigaisha[/i]) also abbreviated as [b]DECO[/b], was a legendary Japanese [[video game]] developer and publisher company active from 1976 to 2003, when it declared bankruptcy. 

Their main headquarters were located in Suginami, Tokyo. The American subsidiary, Data East USA, had been headquartered in San Jose, California.

Data East proved to be one of the more successful and long-lasting companies in the business, surviving the video game crash of 1983 in reasonably good shape and going on to release dozens of games for both arcade and home console systems over the next two decades. Some of their most famous coin-op arcade games from their 80s heyday included [[Metal Clash]], [[Karate Champ]], [[Heavy Barrel]], [[BurgerTime]], [[Dragonninja]], [[Sly Spy]], [[RoboCop]], [[Bump 'n' Jump]], Trio The Punch – Never Forget Me..., [[Karnov]] and [[Atomic Runner Chelnov]]. Karate Champ was the first successful fighting game, due to being one of the most influential to modern fighting game standards. During the late 80s and the 90s they also produced games like [[Midnight Resistance]], [[Crude Buster]], the [[kuhga|Vapor Trail]] trilogy and the [[Joe & Mac: Tatakae Genshijin]] and [[Fighter's History]] series.

Data East also purchased licenses to manufacture and sell arcade games created by other companies. Their most successful licensed games included [[Kid Niki: Radical Ninja]], [[spartan_x|Kung Fu Master]] and [[Vigilante]], all licensed from Irem, and [[Senjou no Ookami]] (Commando), licensed from [[Capcom]]. They had a brief stint as a [[Neo Geo]] arcade licensee in the mid-1990s, starting with [[Spinmaster]].

title: consejo_mundial_de_lucha_libre
body: Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) is a Mexican professional [[wrestling]] company founded in [[Mexico City]] with Luchas scheduled in [[Guadalajara]], [[State of Puebla|Puebla]], and elsewhere in central and southern [[Mexico]]. The promoter is also called by its previous name Empresa Mexicana de la Lucha Libre (EMLL). It is currently the oldest professional wrestling promoter in Mexico and the world that is still in existence.

title: who_is_nijika?_(meme)
body:
A copypasta originating from a comment under the video "Metric - Lost Kitten Nijika (Bocchi the Rock)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkAr25tA7SA], a variation on the "If X has a million fans, I am one of them" format focused on [[Ijichi Nijika]]. It goes as follows:

Who is Nijika?
For the blind, she is vision.
For the hungry, she is the chef.
For the thirsty, she is water.
If Nijika thinks, I agree.
If Nijika speaks, I’m listening.
If Nijika has a million fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has ten fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has only one fan, that is me.
If Nijika has no fans, I no longer exist.
If the whole world is against Nijika, I am against the whole world.
I will love Nijika until my very last breath.

Variations on post #6764418, the image used in the thumbnail for the video, are common.

The members are [[Aris (blue archive)|Aris]], [[Aru (blue archive)|Aru]], [[Hifumi (blue archive)|Hifumi]], and [[Yuuka (blue archive)|Yuuka]].

The uniform consists of a [[cropped shirt]], [[sleeveless shirt]], [[detached sleeves]], [[blue sailor collar]], loose [[waist ribbon]], and a [[pleated skirt]].

The basic color scheme of this outfit is blue and white, but this color scheme may change depending on the character who is wearing the outfit.

title: colt_commando
body:
The Colt Commando (also known with designations [b]XM177[/b] or GAU-5) is an [[united states|American]] 5.56×45mm NATO [[assault rifle]]. It is essentially the shorter variant of the [[M16A1]]. Entered service in 1966, the weapon saw first use during the [[Vietnam War]].

The term CAR-15 originally refers to any Colt-marketed [[AR-15]], but it became associated with this [[military]] variant. 

h4. See also

body:

The character has since become an icon of [[Dia De Muertos]], with many revelers dressing up as her with [[calavera]] makeup.

Her male equivalent is [[El Catrin]].

title: vladimir_putin
body:
[b]Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin[/b] ([b]Влади́мир Влади́мирович Пу́тин[/b], b. 7 October 1952)

Current president (2000-2008, 2012- ) and former prime minister (1999-2000, 2008-2012) of the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] and former [[Soviet]] [[KGB]] agent.

A controversial figure, he has initially developed a cult following in [[Japan]], who often depict him as "the manliest and most unstoppable leader on earth". This has reached the point that there is a [[comic|manga]] based of his public image as well as an annual calendar of him being sold in Japan. Though his memetic status has been significantly subsided after he ordered [[russo-ukrainian_war|the invasion of Ukraine in 2022]].

h1. See also
* [[Tag group:People]]

title: nabe
body:
Any of a number of communally shared Japanese dishes cooked in a clay or iron hot pot, right at the table.  Diners dip in the components they wish into the shared broth and then retrieve them when they are cooked to taste.  Nabe is frequently served with a dipping sauce ([i]tare[/i]).

h4.  Common types of nabe

* [[Oden]] - A mix of [[hardboiled egg]]s, [[fish cake]], [[daikon]] radish, [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]], and other ingredients.
* [[Sukiyaki]] - A mix of thinly-sliced beef, [[spring onion]], [[tofu]], [[mushroom]], leafy green vegetables, and noodles.

h4.  See also

* [[Hotpot]]
* [[Neko nabe]]
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

title: mikumikudance
body:
Miku Miku Dance (MMD) is a freeware [[3D]] animation software, named after [[Vocaloid]] character [[Hatsune Miku]] for which it was originally created. Though models can be ported for use with it, often users create their own models for the software for use, which may contain their own distinct quirks. Use this tag for images that reference/[[parody]] the software.

For images created with the software, head over to [[MikuMikuDance (medium)]].

h4. Models

title: mishy
body:
A mascot character of [[falcom|Nihon Falcom]]. Cat-like creature with white and gray tuxedo pattern. Always stands in the form of a human and never crawls on its paws. 

Initially was introduced in the [[eiyuu densetsu|Kiseki series]] as mascot character of Mishelam Wonderland in [[zero_no_kiseki|Zero]] and [[Ao no Kiseki]]. In-game appears as [[stuffed_animal|plushie]] and sold as merch.

Also appears as a cameo of sorts in [[Nayuta no Kiseki]] and [[Ys viii lacrimosa of dana|Ys 8]].

h4. See also

* [[Tio Plato]], huge Mishy fan.

title: s1e13_umamusume
body:
[tn]"(That) Horse Girl from Season 1 Episode 13"[/tn]

Unnamed anime-only [[Umamusume]] character. Most 'famous' for giving [[Trainer_(umamusume)|Team Spica's Trainer-san]] a kick to the face at the end of Season 1 Episode 13.

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] (sometimes [[blue hair|bluish-grey]]) hair, with a single [[white hair|white]] forelock. Wears an [[orange bow|orange]] [[ear bow]] on [b]her right ear[/b]. Highly resembles an older version of [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]].

Initially speculated to be Kitasan Black (and tagged such on Japanese websites) before the latter made a named appearance in Season 2.

title: laurels
body:
Small leaves of the [i]Lauraceae[/i] family of shrubs. These are typically woven together to form a [[laurel crown]].

Often used to represent popular acclaim, great successes in war, or (in Greco-Roman derived mythology) divinity.

h4. See also
* [[olive branch]]
* [[wreath]]

title: olive_branch
body:
A [[branch]] from the olive tree. Originally a symbol of supplication in Greco-Roman culture, in modern day usage the olive branch has come to be seen as a symbol of peace. Often depicted in the mouth of a [[dove]].

h4. See also
* [[laurels]]
* [[wreath]]

title: zas_m76_(dancer_of_the_night)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Zas M76 (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the game's fourth anniversary 'Soiree Sonata' skin collection in 2020.

Zas M76 switches out her usual beret for a smaller [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with a red-and-white [[hat ornament]], allowing her to add two [[hair flower]]s and [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] for the occasion. Her formal attire consists of a [[black dress|black]]-[[gradient dress|to]]-[[red dress|red]] [[asymmetrical dress]], leaving the left side of her body slightly more exposed, with only a [[black bandeau|black]] [[bandeau]] keeping her covered. Around her waist, the black of the dress transitions briefly into stark red by way of the [[Yugoslavian flag]] and [[olive branch]] dress ornament, connecting into its [[red sash|red]] [[sash]].  Paired with the dress is a small [[black scarf|black]] [[scarf]], [[black gloves|black]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[thigh boots]], with a discrete knife [[sheath]] hidden near their top, with [[red ribbon]]s trailing to the ground. With her, she has a filled [[wine glass]], and a [[weapon case]] upon which the Serbian [[coat of arms]] are emblazoned. Both are discarded in favor of her namesake rifle when damaged.

title: unworn_bow
body: A [[bow]] is present in the image, but is not being worn by the character.

title: imminent_netorare
body:
As [[netorare]] involves infidelity in which someone close to the protagonist (usually someone's lover, though the dilution of the word has meant that it has also been applied to friends, unrequited love interests, or even relatives) is usually unwillingly seduced and stolen away, imminent netorare involves images where that taking away will soon occur. 

Posts on Danbooru tagged with this should include [[doujin cover]]s for doujin where the theme is netorare; pools and parent posts where the end result is netorare; and the moments before netorare occurs. The one taking the loved one can be present, but cannot be actively penetrating or otherwise taking the loved one.

title: no_scarf
body:
When a character who usually wears [[scarf]] (e.g. [[Oma Kokichi]], [[Tateyama Ayano]]) as part of signature outfit or canonical design, is seen [b]not wearing[/b] it.
The respective scarf should not appear on the image. Otherwise, use [[unworn scarf]] instead.
